title: .NET Developer
description:
As a family-owned business our people are central to our success, and following years of organic, consecutive growth, we’re looking for people who share our core values of sustainability, trust, collaboration, and innovation to drive us forwards.
Software never stays the same and neither do we. We want our people to be part of a progressive organisation, encouraged to embrace change and new ideas to shape our future development. Your input is vital, which is why we’re committed to personalised learning paths for every employee to help you, and us, grow.
Our goal is to make the world of work easier as a leader in the HR, payroll, finance, and integration solutions software and services industry. We’re proud to design and develop some of the best business solutions like iTrent and People First to support our customers’ people-related challenges across every vertical.
Looking for the place where you can belong? Join MHR and help us shape the world of work.

Provide high quality and effective product development. Drive technical change, review code base and ensure that everyone is following same technical direction. Act as a bridge between architecture and the production team.

  • Driving technical change, working closely with the engineering and development manager, leads and the architects, scheduling in workshops and training days.
  • Coaching software engineers.
  • Working closely with the architecture team, reviewing their proposal and aligning them with our code base/product.
  • Produce prototypes that could be handed over to the software engineers for full scale development.
  • Constantly review code base, propose suggestions, where we can remove waste, complexity, inefficiency and misalignment.
  • Undertake research as required and attend conferences and events, documenting afterwards to extend the team knowledge.
  • Documenting decisions and progress in line with corporate and team project management.
  • Identify and resolve development issues for other team members.
  • Hands on coding as required.
  • Participate where required in employee recruitment process.

Support:
Assess the impact of reported or suspected product defects and advise accordingly.

  • Advise on, produce and test product corrections in accordance with prevailing standards.
  • Provide advice and assistance to meet time critical or contractual commitments.
  • Respond to customer queries directly, professionally and effectively.
  • On agreement, attend on customer site to undertake product-related tasks.

Organisation:

  • Identify product or procedural deficiencies and recommend action.
  • Proactively record and disseminate product and technical knowledge to colleagues and throughout the organisation as appropriate.
  • Identify requirements and opportunities for personal development including technical and product training.

Key Skills:

  • C#
  • REST
  • Unit Testing
  • SQL-Hibernate/JPA
  • Design Patterns
  • Build Tools
  • Infrastructure
  • OOP
  • DDD
  • Performance Testing
  • Security

How We Work:

  • Azure DevOps is used to manage backlogs, builds and releases.
  • Core hours are used to minimise interruptions to developers.
  • Our products are shipped at least every two weeks.
  • We sponsor tech events such as Tech Nottingham and Hack24.

Your Development:

  • You will be actively encouraged to grow your skills by pursing self-learning or attending conferences.
  • You can either broaden your knowledge by learning new skills within the .NET sphere, or by branching out into other areas like Angular, Java or Azure.
  • You will be surrounded by other experienced developers

Benefits to support you personally and professionally

In addition to working with amazing people, with the freedom to be you, we provide a range of tailored benefits including:

  • Access to over 60 internal training courses, plus the ability to study for professional qualifications as well as cross-departmental mentoring and coaching programmes
  • Access to a GP 24/7, via SmartHealth - whole family access to GPs, confidential mental health support and the security of paid sick leave
  • Option to buy and sell additional holiday days on top of your standard 25 days and bank holidays
  • Discounts and cash back on leisure, travel, technology, fashion, gym memberships and food
  • Monthly company employee recognition programme and departmental awards
  • Referral bonus scheme up to £2,000
  • Employee-led social events, including running clubs, football teams, book club and bake-offs
  • Subsidised restaurants with a choice of fresh meals from our chefs each day
  • Opt-in benefits schemes, ranging from private medical insurance to dental

We care about the health, wellbeing and financial stability of our people and want to ensure they’re working in an inclusive and supportive environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From £60,000.00 per year

  • Private medical insurance
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

  • Will you now or in the future require visa sponsorship?
  • Are you able to commute to Ruddington, Nottingham (3 days a week in the office, 2 days working from home)

Experience:

  • .NET: 2 years (preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Nottingham

title: Software Engineering Manager
description:
As a family-owned business our people are central to our success, and following years of organic, consecutive growth, we’re looking for people who share our core values of sustainability, trust, collaboration, and innovation to drive us forwards.

Software never stays the same and neither do we. We want our people to be part of a progressive organisation, encouraged to embrace change and new ideas to shape our future development. Your input is vital, which is why we’re committed to personalised learning paths for every employee to help you, and us, grow.

Our goal is to make the world of work easier as a leader in the HR, payroll, finance, and integration solutions software and services industry. We’re proud to design and develop some of the best business solutions like iTrent and People First to support our customers’ people-related challenges across every vertical.

Looking for the place where you can belong? Join MHR and help us shape the world of work.

The role of the Software Engineering Manager entails the leadership and management of teams comprising software engineers and testers. Their primary responsibility is to provide guidance, mentorship, and coaching to foster the development of a highly efficient and cohesive team. They offer clear technical and career guidance to enable team members to achieve and sustain a remarkable level of operational excellence.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead and manage a team of software engineers and testers, providing guidance, mentoring and coaching.
  • Ensure best practices in Software Development are maintained.
  • Ensure quality, scalability, and maintainability of code and software architecture.
  • Monitor team performance, set performance goals, conduct regular performance evaluations, and provide feedback.
  • Working with Scrum Masters, identify and address any issues or challenges faced by the team and implement solutions to improve efficiency and productivity.
  • Drive a generative culture of high cooperation where learning is the heart of everything we do.
  • Work closely with the Product Design Team to manage the resources required to achieve the product roadmaps considering recruitment, training, and the acquisition of tools and frameworks in a timely fashion to avoid delays in delivery.
  • To be an advocate of the Agile development practices employed by the development function.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies and seek opportunities to apply them to the team's work.
  • Promote and develop a culture of Continual improvement where Engineering teams are continually striving to be the best.
  • Communicate effectively with team members, stakeholders, and clients, providing regular updates on product progress and issues to manage expectations.

Benefits to support you personally and professionally

Alongside the opportunity to work with an incredible team and express your individuality, we offer a range of personalised benefits including:

  • Access to over 60 internal training courses, professional qualifications, and cross-departmental mentoring and coaching programs
  • 24/7 access to a GP through SmartHealth for you and your family, confidential mental health support, and paid sick leave
  • Ability to purchase or sell additional holiday days beyond the standard 25 days and bank holidays
  • Discounts and cashback on leisure, travel, technology, fashion, gym memberships, and food
  • Monthly employee recognition program and departmental awards
  • Referral bonus scheme of up to £2,000
  • Employee-led social events such as running clubs, football teams, book clubs, and bake-offs
  • On-site subsidised restaurants offering a variety of fresh meals daily
  • Opt-in benefits schemes such as private medical insurance and dental coverage

We value the well-being, financial stability, and inclusivity of our employees, and strive to provide a supportive working environment.

title: Lead Developer
description:
Position: Lead Developer
Company: Insolvency Service
Location: Hybrid/Nottingham
Contract: Full-time, permanent
Salary: Up to £58,828 + 35% pension

*

About Insolvency Service

Insolvency Service is a leading Government agency that supports people and companies in financial difficulties, champions creditors’ interests and ensure that commerce functions fairly and transparently. You will operate at our heart – strengthening a friendly multidisciplinary team that develops, supports and maintains all our line-of-business applications.

In the last 12 months, Insolvency Service have supported over 120,000 people in financial difficulty through our bankruptcy, debt relief order and breathing space services. The work Insolvency Service do has a big impact on people’s lives every day, often when they’re at their most desperate and vulnerable, so it is vital that great services are delivered with the utmost care and professionalism.

The solutions you deliver will enable people to rebuild their finances, secure breathing space from their creditors, obtain redundancy payments and hold fraudulent directors to account, so you will transform thousands of lives every year.

*

What’s the role about?

We’re looking for a Lead .NET Developer to join our busy, multidisciplinary team in Digital Services, Insolvency Service. Digital Services are responsible for developing, maintaining and supporting the agency’s line of business applications.

Digital Services is a predominantly an in-house team, with a small 3rd party DevSecOps function. We’ve recently moved away from a hybrid development and support partnership, with the aim of bringing the function in-house. We’d love to for you to be part of that new team.

We provide key services including:

  • Service Governance
  • Business Relationship Management
  • Service Architecture
  • Digital Services
  • Cyber Security and Information Governance
  • Digital Programme Delivery

*

What will you do?

  • Lead our Developers in one of our agile teams, acting as a mentor, coach as well as being one of our Principal Developers
  • Be able to guide the way that the other developers in the team work
  • Be proficient in a wide range of technical systems
  • To be involved in identifying appropriate technology and approaches, deciding when software should be written
  • Contribute to the developer community
  • Proomote a culture of knowledge sharing and the adoption of good practice

*

What do you need?

  • You will be a subject matter expert in .NET
  • You will be an experienced lead supporting and mentoring junior developers
  • You will have experience as a full stack developer, used to working on frontend, API/Webservice and database applications
  • You will have experience in developing for the cloud, preferably Microsoft Azure
  • You will be proficient at implementing software development patterns and standards such as MVC, REST, SOLID, SOA, OIDC or OAUTH.
  • You will demonstrate an understanding of integration patterns such as real-time, scheduled, API, batch or messaging services
  • You will be proficient at implementing and checking code quality including adoption of Test-Driven Development, peer reviews and code analysis
  • You will have experience of working in a multi-disciplinary team in an Agile fashion

Desirable

  • Familiarity with GOV.UK’s Service Standards and building services against those standards would be beneficial

*

What’s in it for me?

  • Civil Service Pension
  • Advances on salary (EFA Advances)
  • Wellbeing and mental health support
  • Civil Service Sports Club
  • Recognition of hard work: INSpire and GEM awards
  • Flexible working and flexi hours
  • Discounts on days out and activities
  • Learning and Development opportunities
  • Relocation schemes including ‘Places for Growth’

*

Please note that sponsorship is not available with this opportunity

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work authorisation:

  • United Kingdom (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Nottingham

title: System Engineer
description:
We currently have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a CNC/PLC Systems & Software Engineer (Machine control systems) based in Binley, Coventry. You will join us on a full-time, permanent basis, and in return, you will receive a competitive salary of £40,000-£60,000 depending on skills/experience and ability.

About the CNC/PLC Systems & Software Engineer role

You will be working on new and exciting projects, alongside the on-going development of existing product lines, responsible for the design & integration of Fanuc and Siemens CNC systems and Siemens PLC systems.

You will be designing, implementing, updating & maintaining multi-axis (up to 28 axes/ 13 path) control systems and be a key part of the complete product development, suggesting new ideas and areas for improvement based on your experience.

For the right person, although not on a frequent basis, there will also be opportunity for some travel outside the UK, with engineers having travelled to, Europe, Americas & Asia previously.

About us:

Wickman Coventry Ltd is an OEM Machine tool, design and manufacturing, organisation, now in its 99th year. We produce our specialised range of Multi-spindle CNC and Automatic Lathes from our Coventry factory. This is an excellent opportunity to join a long-established technology lead company with a diverse range of work on offer to a bright, enthusiastic individual.

Benefits we offer:

  • Generous holiday entitlement – with flexibility to allow part day booking
  • Flexibility in working times
  • Contributory Pension scheme
  • Cycle to work scheme

Your responsibilities as our CNC/PLC Systems & Software Engineer will include

  • Production and maintenance of electrical schematics and Bills of material based on an Electrical CAD system (WSCAD)
  • Developing control systems & software for PLC machines and CNC machines with up to 28 axes and13 simultaneous path control
  • Integration of ancillary equipment on to our standard machine platforms
  • Working as part of a team including process engineers and mechanical designers to develop and prove machine operation
  • Technical direction and management of the machine wireman (Not administrative management)
  • Training of the machine wireman to undertake basic commissioning tasks (software loading and configuration etc.)
  • Commissioning of machinery
  • Training in machine operation
  • Produce manuals & technical documents relating to the machines control and operation
  • Maintain the necessary records for the technical file in respect of CE marking (Electrical Elements)
  • Implementation of design solutions/upgrades and add-ons to existing control designs
  • Liaison with external suppliers to ensure concept feasibility
  • Specification & procurement of systems to ensure they meet the design requirements
  • Liaise with clients and colleagues to ensure that the specification requirements are fully met
  • Supporting colleagues and customers with technical issues relating to the machine control.

What we’re looking for in our CNC/PLC Systems & Software Engineer:

  • An enthusiasm for machine tool control systems
  • Ability to work with minimum direction
  • Either: A proven track record in CNC /PLC design & Applications or An ability and willingness to learn
  • The ability to communicate with all levels of personnel within the company, from shop floor to the MD
  • A willingness to “get stuck in” and a hands-on approach to do whatever is required to progress a project (e.g. Making wiring modifications, removing/refitting covers etc.)
  • The knowledge and ability to understand the system designs that are already in use
  • Strong time and project management skills, with the ability to work on several projects simultaneously
  • Computer literate in MS packages
  • Some experience of Electrical CAD Systems. WSCAD would be ideal.

If you’re looking for a new challenge, please click apply now to be considered as our CNC/PLC Systems & Software Engineer, we look forward to hearing from you!

title: Software Engineer
description:
Digital Technology Software Engineering Degree Apprenticeship

At E.ON, we help our customers to take control of their energy use and we are always looking for new and improved ways of doing things. E.ON has customers across a variety of industries, using the latest technology to help build a better energy future. In Digital Technology, we work to support business areas by automating processes and building new solutions to drive innovation.

Here's what you'll be doing

As part of the four-year Digital Technology degree apprenticeship, you will have the opportunity to gain practical, hands-on experience working with a variety of teams through six-month placements across the business. As an apprentice, you will be employed by E.ON but will study part-time at Nottingham Trent University for a fully-funded BSc (Hons) in Digital and Technology Solutions (Software Engineering).

You will have the opportunity to select placements to suit your interests and skills, examples include:

  • Spend time with the cyber security team helping to protect our colleagues and customers through supporting penetration testing, exploring vulnerabilities and investigating fraudulent companies.
  • Contribute to our data strategy.
  • Learn about what E.ON does to contribute to sustainability, get involved yourself, while helping automate and digitalise processes.
  • Understand how a Digital Technology operation functions, reviewing budget controls and working with suppliers to fulfil technology needs.

Throughout your time on the programme, you will be fully supported at E.ON by the early careers talent team, your mentor and a dedicated buddy from a previous degree apprenticeship scheme.

There is the opportunity for part of a placement to be completed overseas at an E.ON office in Germany, plus work with international colleagues on placements within the UK.

What we need from you
  • 5 GCSEs or equivalent, including grade 4 or above in English Language and grade 5 or above in Maths.
  • 3 A-Levels including either Maths, Science or IT totalling 120 UCAS points or equivalent (for example level 3 BTEC in computer science or IT, relevant T-level). Additional A-levels which will not be accepted are citizenship skills, general studies and critical thinking. A preceding level apprenticeship or equivalent demonstrable work experience in the occupation area can be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.
Here’s what you need to know
  • Your base location will be our offices in either Nottingham or Coventry. We operate a hybrid working model, and though this may vary from placement to placement, you will be expected to come into the office between 1-3 days a week, with home working an option on other days. Other company funded travel will be required and this role will also include placement opportunities at other E.ON sites across the UK.
  • This apprenticeship leads to a BSc (Hons) in Digital and Technology Solutions (Software Engineering) awarded by Nottingham Trent University. This is done on block release, currently spending six blocks (each of five days) on campus each year.
  • We offer an initial starting salary of £19,350 with potential pay progressions throughout the scheme based on academic and placement performance.
  • Our market leading benefits package includes 26 days’ holiday plus eight bank holidays, a generous pension scheme, and the chance to choose from 20 flexible benefits, including the option to buy up to two weeks’ extra holiday.
  • Please note, you may only apply for one E.ON degree/level 7 apprenticeship scheme, so please choose the one that suits you best.

E.ON is committed to being an inclusive employer. We recognise that everyone is different and we aim to provide a working environment where each person feels respected, valued and able to achieve their full potential. We are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. If you require any reasonable adjustments, please just let us know.

At a glance

Reference no.:

222837

Closing date:

01/03/2024

Salary:

£19,350
Get in touch

For more information please contact EarlyCareers@eon-uk.com

About us
E.ON is a privately owned international energy company. Our 75,000 colleagues in 15 countries work daily towards the improvement of technical innovations and user-friendly customer solutions for the new energy world. We are the first large energy company to focus more heavily upon the energy of the future through our three business areas of energy networks, renewable energies and customer solutions.
Connect with us

title: Back End Developer
description:
Job title: Back-End Engineer

Team: Offer Management

Location: Amsterdam/Groningen, NL - or - Fully-remote from a complimentary timezone

Environment: On-site/Hybrid/Remote (you decide!)

Timezone: +/- 2 hours of CET

Language: Our business language is English



Where the journey began…

From humble beginnings when travelling back in 2014, our co-founders at Parkos embarked on our journey to ensure that the beginning and end of your travel experience are as enjoyable as the actual adventure between!

We make airport parking a smooth, seamless and efficient process for all travellers using our TravelTech price comparison & booking platform.

We started off by winning the major airports within the Netherlands and now operate in over 15 different countries and 3 different regions (and counting)! We’ve grown to over 120 Parkie’s and millions of travellers choose Parkos every year!


The team

Our Offer Management team currently consists of a mixture of long-standing Developers (both mid-level and senior+), a dedicated Product Manager, and an Engineering Team Lead.

They own topics that deal with our parking merchants and airport partners including fast search, digital inventory management, and competitor analysis to ensure our customer-base is getting the very best deal on their airport parking!

We’ve experienced rapid growth in recent years and have introduced a microservices strategy based around Kubernetes to leave our monolith behind and to standardise our processes. On the back-end, we are enabling this by utilising Node.js, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and SQL databases.


What you’ll do

  • Build inventory search and data management systems that support core price and availability comparison

  • Provide mentorship and guidance to less senior developers

  • Influence technical decisions across teams

  • Independently work on tasks, contribute to team projects, and occasionally lead small projects

  • Identify, prioritise, and solve high-impact problems. Proactively propose improvements and identify risks while managing time responsibly


What you’ll bring

  • Proficiency in JavaScript (TypeScript), back-end engineering principles such as search optimisation and IO performance tuning

  • Functional programming experience is highly desirable but we also welcome candidates who can demonstrate proficiency.

  • Strong understanding of time complexity of algorithms and data structures. Experience with build tools, version control systems, and CI/CD pipelines.

  • Experience working with remote, distributed teams in an agile, multi-region environment having a strong sense of ownership

  • Effective communication skills with an ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

  • A continuous learning mentality and an interest in keeping up-to-date with technological advances and industry standards


What we offer

  • Flexible working: We understand that people’s circumstances vary and allow you to decide where you work from. We can support on-site, hybrid, and fully-remote (so long as the timezones aren’t too far apart!)

  • Ownership: Take ownership of your work and have the opportunity to drive lasting change within Parkos

  • Growth: We provide the autonomy and personal development support for you to move quickly through the ranks at Parkos - the sky's the limit!

  • Transparency: We talk about our plans, allow everyone a voice, work together towards common objectives, and share our successes together as a team

  • Fast-pace: We love to experiment and try new things quickly. An error is only a mistake when you fail to correct it and we want to reach our destination as swiftly and smoothly as possible!

  • A modern (MACH) architecture: We work with a solid and modern software architecture to ensure all our applications are running smoothly and at scale. In cooperation with the DevOps team, we continuously refine our processes, applications and infrastructure.


The road ahead…

  • Fit Interview with recruiter (45 mins)

  • Technical Assignment (3 hours)

  • Pair programming & Team Q&A (1 hour)

  • Executive Interview (1 hour)


Step 3 will extend your own solution from step 2. During step 3 we will add 2 features and discuss the strengths and weaknesses of different approaches. We recommend using Visual Studio Code which has excellent remote pair programming extensions such as Live Share but we are open to you using the editor of your choice as long as we can participate using tools that give us equivalent access to that provided by Live Share.

-

At Parkos, we are fully committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace, free from discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, or any other protected characteristic. We foster an environment where all employees are valued, respected, and empowered, complying with all applicable laws to ensure fairness and equity. Embracing diversity enhances our company culture and strengthens our ability to serve our customers, and we continuously strive to promote equal opportunities through collaboration, support, and ongoing improvement.

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen within this leading Hinckley based manufacturing company for a Software Test Engineer to join its growing engineering department.

THE ROLE

Your main responsibilities will be:

  • Collaborate closely with Project Managers and developers to thoroughly test products.
  • Test functionality during sprints in collaboration with the development team.
  • Develop and maintain comprehensive test plans.
  • Define, write, and implement test cases based on acceptance criteria.
  • Contribute to improving test processes and automation in an agile environment.
  • Establish expertise within the team for QA and Automation matters.
  • Create scripts and test tools to support testing efforts.
  • Effectively use bug reporting and task management systems.
  • Design and execute test scenarios demonstrating product behavior.
  • Monitor and escalate system-related defects for timely resolution and re-testing

THE PERSON

In order to succeed in the role of Software Test Engineer you will ideally have some relevant experience in software or in automated testing. This role would also suit a graduate that is keen to move their career into this area. You will need to be self-motivated with strong decision-making skills and the ability to work alone or within a small team.

THE PACKAGE

  • Pension

  • Flexible Working

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:

title: Front End Developer
description:
Front End Developer

Job details

Posted 02 January 2024

title: Java Developer
description:
Remote / Flexible / Variable Hours, Other Agile Working Arrangements / Open to Discussion

Can you think strategically and ‘join the dots’ across multiple activities to build the bigger picture? Do you enjoy working at pace, identifying new and improved ways of doing things and collaborating with a wide range of stakeholders? Are you passionate to develop new software’s in Java and make a difference to how our client operates?

If so, we would love to hear from you.

We are looking for Java Software Developers to join our client’s team. As a Java Software Engineer, you will join one of our clients small, fast-paced, agile delivery teams; using agile methodology and DevOps techniques to build backend systems, data processing pipelines, and progressive web apps for customers.

Responsibilities

Java Software Engineering at our client’s organisation consists of a wide range of responsibilities, the list below gives a flavour of some of the tasks you may be asked to undertake.

  • Implementing Java software solutions including design, development, and testing.
  • Use a wide range of technologies, specialising in the use of open-source libraries and components.
  • Use tools such as GitLab to build continuous integration pipelines, which help monitor and ensure software quality and security.
  • Deploy Java software systems to a mixture of environments including public (AWS and Azure) and private cloud.

Full Software Lifecycle involvement:

  • Project concept formalisation
  • Requirement’s analysis and specification
  • Software architecture design
  • Software implementation and delivery
  • Software training and support
  • Software lifecycle and maintenance

Candidate specification

Our clients Java Software Engineers enjoy working on a variety of interesting and challenging projects, so they want their team to have a proactive and can-do attitude to their work. They pride on keeping up with emerging technologies and delivery best-practice, so it is important that you enjoy learning and continuous improvement.

You will ideally have exposure to.

  • Contemporary Java software engineering including selection and application of appropriate technology and patterns.
  • Confidence developing Java full-stack solutions as a polyglot developer/engineer.
  • DevOps and the techniques which enable it - including virtualisation, containerisation, continuous integration, continuous deployment, and infrastructure as code.
  • Working with high-level stakeholders - both internally and externally.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Software Engineer

Salary up to £55k (DOE)

The successful Software Engineer will be working for a Company that specialises in the design and manufacture of safety-critical electronic systems to assist the safer operation of materials handling vehicles and equipment. The Software Engineer will assume a pivotal role within our expanding R&D team. Your primary responsibilities will encompass the facilitation of new product design, comprehensive root cause analysis for potential malfunctions, and the refinement of our existing product portfolio. Additionally, you will serve as a crucial source of technical expertise for our production department, actively participating in the enhancement of production processes while considering essential design parameters. Proficiency in embedded systems coding and a thorough understanding of product design life cycles are paramount for this role.

Key Responsibilities
Design and develop embedded systems for safety-critical applications.
    • Write, test, and debug code in languages like C/C and assembly.
    • Design modular code architecture for embedded systems.
    • Break down functionalities into independent modules.
    • Participate in the design phase to define embedded system requirements.
    • Integrate and interface hardware components (microcontrollers, sensors, etc.).
    • Create and understand schematics and design PCBs for system integration.
    • Develop and integrate real-time operating systems (RTOS) or custom firmware.
    • Prototype and test embedded systems to ensure functionality.
    • Design and execute regression tests after updates.
    • Troubleshoot and debug hardware and software issues.
    • Maintain clear documentation of designs and code.
    • Develop comprehensive test plans for embedded systems.
    • Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations for coding such as MISRA.
    • Adhere to coding standards for cohesive module integration
The Right Person

It is essential that the successful Software Engineer will have experience in the following area(s):
BEng or MEng degree or equivalent in Electronic, software of embedded system Engineering, or similar.
    • 3 years of industry experience.
    • Proficient in C and C programming languages.
    • Deep understanding of microcontroller/microprocessor architectures.
    • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
    • Familiarity with hardware components and interfaces.
    • Understanding of analog and digital mixed-signal systems.
    • Version control system (e.g., Git) proficiency.
    • Testing and validation expertise.
    • Basic circuit design and PCB understanding.
    • Development from prototype through to manufacture.
    • Technical writing and documentation.
Interested? Here are your three options

1. “This is the job for me, I meet all the requirements” – Call now and let’s talk through your experience. Ask for Jon Webster on between 8.30am – 5.30pm

2. “I think I’m right for this position, but I’m not sure about some of the detail” – Click “apply now” so I can read your CV and come back to you.

3. “I’m interested but need to know more about what this job can offer me” – email jon@precisionrecruitment.co.uk with your CV and questions and I will reply with more detail.

Precision are committed to keeping our candidates informed and offer a guaranteed response within 7 days when applying through the application system.


PPTP

title: Business Developer
description:
Who we are. What we do.

We are Bystronic – a global technology company passionate about creating an impact for a sustainable future with sheet metal and beyond.
We want to work with people who support us in creating innovative solutions to move our industry forward. Our focus is on automating the complete material and data flow of the laser cutting and bending process chain.

In a nutshell

This is a unique opportunity to join our rapidly expanding global company with a market leading position in its segment. We are looking for an experienced aftermarket Talent who will proactively lead service activities and provide great customer experience to our clients in the region (UK & Ireland).

What drives this department

At Bystronic, we promote ownership, collaboration and a culture of respect and innovation. If you live by these values, come and join our Global Service team!

What you will be doing

  • Contribute to the achievement of after sales targets as agreed with local management and Bystronic service products portfolio in line with strategic service business unit
  • Develop and enhance the relationship and revenue with customers with a specific focus on inactive and lost customers
  • Support, foster & grow long-term relationships with the customer base.
  • Lead and promote the Bystronic culture and values. Create a positive and inclusive working environment for all team members.
  • Support the machines sales teams with after sales portfolio
  • Support the development of local campaigns with HQ Product Management based upon market needs & Service BU Strategic goals

Your education & experience

  • Proven track record in a competitive B2B sales environment, ideally 3-5 years in a sales role
  • Familiarity with the machinery market, Services as well as sales know-how in capital goods
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office including PowerPoint, Excel, Word and SharePoint
  • Excellent communication and influencing skills
  • Strong customer focus and ability to balance client’s and own organisation’s needs to ensure high level of customer satisfaction
  • English fluency, both written and oral

What’s in it for you

Our culture is driven by innovation, openness and commitment to our customers, to our colleagues and to our company. We offer a wide range of responsibilities, development opportunities, the highest technology standards & innovation in the industry. We support and develop our employees to enhance their career and develop their skills & knowledge. In return to your efforts & results, we offer attractive social benefits.

  • Company pension
  • Gym membership
  • Private medical insurance
  • Referral programme

People power our purpose

Imagine working in an environment that helps move the company to the next level, where your passion, values, and skills are integral to impacting the sheet metal industry and beyond. At Bystronic, this can become your reality. Our people are the edge to drive and nurture our ambitions and continued success. Together we have created a culture where our people are central, inspiring us to make decisions that best serve them and are aligned with our purpose.
As much as we are in a technology business, human beings drive real change.

Interested?

Does this versatile challenge appeal to you? Then we look forward to getting to know you! You can submit your application on our platform
We look forward to receiving your online application

title: Web Developer
description:
Reference: TQ2324_2137_314

Vacancy: 3

Job title: Lead Angular Web Developer

Location: Leicester

Job Purpose:

TESTQ Technologies is an IT services and solutions company whose offerings spans over variety of industry sectors with strong technical, domain and process expertise helping clients grow their businesses and decrease operational costs on continuous basis in an ever-changing business environment.

This opportunity is in the solution design and development arena for Lead Angular Web Developer who will play a major role with the technical design and development of the company’s technical offerings. The position is based at our Leicester office with occasional assignments at client locations.

Job Description (Main Duties and Responsibilities):

  • Participate in sprint planning activities with the entire team.
  • Document code consistently throughout the development process by listing a description of the program, special instructions, and any changes made in database tables on procedural, modular and database level
  • Creation of software that satisfies the technical criteria of business for system performance and functionality
  • An Angular Web Developer is needed to join our thriving team. With the help of Angular best practices, you will oversee developing a top-level coding basis. Your job will require you to implement a fun and efficient system.
  • Iterate on existing functionality to constantly improve and refine UI, functionality, and code quality
  • Together with the QA Analyst, make sure that all features are tested thoroughly and promptly.
  • to create user experiences that are testing, intuitive, and customer-focused, yet ambitious in their practical simplicity.
  • Make suggestions for software architecture and behavior to produce a simple-to-use and effective user interface.
  • Release code to staging and production environments
  • To be a co-owner of the code base, suggesting and implementing ways to improve it

Key Skills, Qualifications and Experience Needed [The candidate must demonstrate these in all stages of assessment]

  • Expert in Agile/Scrum Methodologies (Using any tool like JIRA, Mantis, Bugzilla etc.) (Using any tool like JIRA, Mantis, Bugzilla etc.)
  • Experience with Angular v8+, .NET Core / C#
  • Familiar with a build system - ideally Gradle
  • Cooperating with the back-end developer in the process of building the RESTful API
  • Strong understanding of any JavaScript framework, preferably Angular, React, or Vue
  • Strong Azure experience (Functions, Cosmos DB)
  • An expert in project management, and should have a good knowledge of SCSS, HTML, and JavaScript.
  • Strong web testing and troubleshooting skills - the usual web developer tools.
  • Preferably some experience with Redux or other observable state management pattern
  • Good understanding of web security standards (OWASP top 10) and web accessibility (W3C)
  • Strong Integrating with API’s

Other Key skills:

  • Good analytical and Problem-solving skills
  • Good communication skills
  • Excellent customer service
  • A thorough approach and Self starter
  • Focus on quality and delivery
  • Working together in teams
  • Leadership and effective decision-making
  • Flexible Attitude

Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree or above in the UK or Equivalent.

Salary:  GBP 29000 to 40000 per annum

Published Date: 15-Dec-2023

Closing Date: 14-Jan- 2024

Evaluation: CV Review, Technical Test, Personal and Technical Interview and References

Job Type: Full-time, Permanent [Part time and Fixed Term option is available] *

Salary: £29,000.00-£40,000.00 per year

  • Monday to Friday

  • Bachelor's (preferred)

title: Software Engineer
description:
I’m looking to speak with back-end biased Software Engineers, who enjoy diving into core business logic work – and like the sound of turning their hand to a bit of everything.

You’ll be working with a team in Castle Donington, who are looking for somebody to come in and work on their Cloud-based WMS suite of products.

(Don’t worry, it’s 80% remote – one day a week onsite)

They’re growing quickly, so you’ll have more than your fair share of greenfield work to sink your teeth into – and they’ll be moving to .NET8 in the New Year, with the introduction of new architecture.

As it stands currently, the products are built using C#, ASP.NET MVC, JavaScript, TypeScript, SQL, WebAPIs and Infragistics, with Kubernetes, Elastic Stack and Docker.

Salary wise, they’ll pay £50,000-£60,000 DOE – realistically, you’ll need 5+ years of exp.

I’ve worked with them for a while now, so I know they look after their Engineers, offering them plenty of opportunities to progress, and encourage everyone to bring new ideas to the table.

If you fancy a quick chat to find out more, get in touch with Jack Leeming @ Optima Dev.

What is the objective of this role and what does it consist of?

ITP Aero is a leading company in the aviation industry, being the ninth aero engine company in the world by sales and ranking among the top one hundred companies in the aviation industry globally.

Around the world, around the clock, we provide the power and support our customers need to fulfil their missions.

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Manufacturing Engineer - Programmer (conventional machining) within the ITP Aero UK (Combustion and Casings). ITP Aero UK, design and supply a range of components for Civil, Business and Defence aerospace.

The Complex Fabrications facility, at Hucknall, is going through significant change and exciting times to support our Customers. To meet the demands of all our Customers we are recruiting Manufacturing Engineers. The purpose of this role is to translate product designs into world-class, cost-effective manufacturing and assembly processes with proven capability to meet customer and business requirements as well as to use PPAP methods to seamlessly deliver new and improve existing products in the manufacturing facility. The role is within the Manufacturing Engineering team that is made up of highly skilled and motivated teams of Manufacturing Engineers and Programmers.

What profile are we looking for?

Key Accountabilities will include:

  • Develop, implement, validate, maintain, and control Methods of Manufacture to realise part designs.
  • Create and maintain the technical package for the shop floor for the manufacture of parts. This will include Technical Instructions, Manufacturing Stage Drawings, Production Routers and control them effectively.
  • Use of Build in Quality tools such as Process Maps, Process Failure Mode Effect Analysis (PFMEAs), and Control Plans.
  • Capture, analyse and use data to demonstrate and improve the current and future technical and cost capability of manufacturing processes.
  • Day-to-day planning of projects in line with milestones, resolve technical problems and exercise professional judgement.
  • Liaise with others as design, manufacturing, quality, and purchasing to ensure delivery of parts to set timescales, targeted costs and verifying the design intent has been met.
  • Liaise with the network of xMRC's to develop cutting strategies for the future.
  • Liaise with third party tooling and carbide suppliers and integrators to improve manufacturing process.
  • Support production to ensure product flow in the factory and drive continuous improvements to eliminate the need for concessions and rework.
  • Control and reduce costs to drive profitability in the factory by continuously challenging the methods of manufacture and the designs.

Key Skills / Qualifications

  • As a Manufacturing Engineer - Programmer, you will need to be degree qualified (or equivalent) or have the requisite technical experience, a passion to succeed and a vision of how modern manufacturing should be achieved.
  • Professionally qualified Engineer (UK minimum HND/foundation degree or other national equivalent).
  • UK IEng (Incorporated Engineer) or CEng (Chartered Engineer) or other national equivalent.
  • Significant experience in the chip-form machining of Nickel and Titanium alloys using 3 and 5 axis machining platforms.
  • Significant experience in the use Siemens / Fanuc controllers
  • Possessing general understanding of manufacturing processes relevant to the business.
  • Possessing general awareness of Manufacturing Systems (NX, CAD, CAM, CAPP, Manufacturing Execution System, Manufacturing Intelligence, SAP, Technical Publications, Teamcenter, etc.) relevant to the business.
  • Having good understanding of Manufacturing Engineering processes relevant to their role in the product lifecycle.
  • Have good communications skills and the ability to influence at all levels of the organisation.

What training will you receive to be able to carry out the role?

You will work alongside a strategic multidisciplinary team for the company, and you will be able to play a major role in the definition and shape of the future of ITP Aero.

You will receive training in-role to support the requirements of the role.

This role is of interest to you if...

- You like working in a busy and challenging environment.

- You are motivated by identifying and implementing improvements to parts and processes to support ITP Aero UK’s route to Zero Defects Journey.

- You enjoy solving technical problems using innovative ideas.

Who will I work with (in my team and in collaboration with other areas)?

You will work at ITP Aero from its site in Hucknall, Nottinghamshire under the guidance of professionals with extensive experience in the sector in a leading company in aeronautical engines and components that ranks among the top companies in the global aeronautical industry.

You will work closely with other enthusiastic manufacturing engineer’s along with the various support functions on site including SPG (Special Process Group), Planning & Control Team, Supply Chain, Operations and the Design team.

What are the working hours?

Days – 37 hours per week working Monday to Friday core hours 08:00-16:12

What is the location?

Address: ITP Aero UK Ltd, Harrier Business Park, Dorey Way, Hucknall, Nottinghamshire, NG15 6EU

Google Maps: https://goo.gl/maps/kCU4BAjtGHk7VsiQ9

What is the remuneration and competitive employee benefits?

Staff Grade: 7-10

  • 25 days annual leave (inclusive of 5 fixed days)
  • 6 Leisure days – Accrued through working an additional hour per week in addition to your contracted hours
  • ITP Aero Group Personal Pension Scheme – Salary Sacrifice pension contributions increase with length of service to a maximum company contribution of 12% after 3 years of service.
  • You will have the option to contribute more to your pension through salary sacrifice Additional Voluntary Contributions (AVC’s).
  • Hybrid Working (dependant on role)
  • Life Assurance – 6x salary to your nominated beneficiary(s)
  • Income Protection - In the event of long term sickness
  • Cycle to Work Scheme
  • Enhanced Sick Pay
  • Enhanced Pay for Maternity and Paternity (in line with statutory service dates)
  • Additional Leave for Marriage, Moving House and Dependant leave
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Access to 24/7 GP
  • Earn vouchers through healthy living
  • Paid Professional Membership
  • Bonus Scheme applicable to role
  • Opportunity for growth and internal promotion

Closing Date

The closing date for applications is 05/01/2024 at midnight.

Often, we receive a high volume of applications for our vacancies. On these occasions, we may close applications for the role early. We recommend submitting your application as early as possible for consideration.

I have questions about the role, who can I contact?

If you need any clarification about the vacancy and/or the recruitment process, please do not hesitate to contact our HR Team via email: ukpeopleteam@itpaero.com

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £36,666.00-£50,603.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Free parking
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

Application deadline: 05/01/2024
Reference ID: 22660

title: Mobile Developer
description:
Role Purpose:

Ideagen is the invisible force behind many things we rely on every day - from keeping airplanes soaring in the sky, to ensuring the food on our tables is safe, to helping doctors and nurses care for the sick. So, when you think of Ideagen, think of it as the silent teammate that's always working behind the scenes to help those people who make our lives safer and better.


Every day millions of people are kept safe using Ideagen software. We have offices all over the world including America, Australia, Malaysia and India with people doing lots of different and exciting jobs.


Ideagen believe that by recruiting diverse and talented individuals, we create an inclusive community for all. We are committed to empowering all colleagues to maximise their potential and express their unique characteristics, experience, and knowledge to achieve their ambitions.


Responsibilities:
  • Implement new features across the Ideagen Products using .Net and open-source technologies.
  • Working closely with Development Manager and Team Leaders, and other Software Engineers to build well architected solutions.
  • Working collaboratively with Product Managers, Technical Product Owners, Development Engineers, Test Engineers, and Infrastructure Engineers to ensure features are delivered to a high standard.
  • Collaborate with the Product Design Team to create an optimal user experience.
  • Work across the Software Development Lifecycle ensuring that our products are delivered to a published roadmap within planned release cycles.
  • Work within an Agile Development Team using e.g., Scrum framework.
  • Contribute towards the defining and developing a Sprint backlog to achieve the goals set out by our Product team.
  • Diagnose, troubleshoot, and fix software defects.
  • Provide unit tests to support and validate any development work undertaken.
Skills and Experience:

About you

  • Experience in a mobile application development role is preferred.
  • Proven ability to deliver technical designed of a commercial native mobile application published on the Google/Apple stores using JavaScript/C#
  • Demonstratable experience implementing .Net / JavaScript programming best practices.
  • A proven ability to deliver technical features within an enterprise application.
  • Experience using Source Control, preferably Git.
  • Database development experience preferably in SQLite, MS SQL, PostgreSQL.
  • Knowledge using CI/CD tools specifically Jenkins, SonarQube, Docker, TeamCity, Octopus or Chef.

Behaviours

  • Ambitious - Drive, Planning & Execution
  • Adventurous - Flexibility, Resilience & Savvy thinking
  • Community - Collaboration & Communication

#LI-NOTTINGHAM

#INDPRO

title: Software Integration Engineer
description:
UST are currently looking recruit an Oracle SOA integration Developer with good Java development skills to be based at one of our clients’ sites in Nottingham

About UST

UST is a leading provider of platforms, digital innovation, artificial Intelligence and end-to-end IT & Business services and solutions for Global 1000 companies. We are transforming corporations through deep domain expertise, knowledge-based ML platforms, as well as profound anthropological efforts to understand the end customer and design products and interactions that create delight.

We are deeply committed to developing a comprehensive understanding of our clients’ problems and to develop platforms to address them.

About the role

The successful candidate will work as part of a self-organised services engineering team to design and develop software features that are delightful and vital to the lives of consumers across all walks of life

You will work to achieve the goals and vision articulated by Product Management and your management chain, your focus will be on a major portion of existing or new team software within your team.

Key deliverables

  • Administer the BPM architecture and configuration across our suite of software applications
  • Develop BPM solutions within the Service Oriented Architecture Methodology
  • Maintain and document customisations / extensions Requirements for role:
  • You have a proven ability to deliver high quality applications at scale
  • Very strong programming skills and knowledge of building API’s using modern OO languages, preferably Java, SOLID principles, SOA, HTTP and REST
  • You have experience working with Oracle Fusion, developing BPM solutions within the Service Oriented Architecture Methodology
  • Experience developing custom BPM workflows and ADF UIs to based on User requirements
  • Experience in developing on Oracle 12c db - e.g. SQL, Relational database skills
  • You’re able to effectively communicate and partner across engineering to maximise inner-sourcing opportunities and reduce waste.
  • You’re an advocate for quality and can lead the team leveraging approaches such as Pair Programming, TDD and BDD Experience that would be advantageous:
  • Working with the cloud/AWS and the opportunities that it brings

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
Year in Industry - July 2024 to July 2025 (12 month placement)

Job description:
Maya HTT is a leading developer of mechanical engineering simulation software and datacenter infrastructure management solutions, boasting a variety of products deployed across many industries. In addition to developing software, Maya also specializes in providing services including software customization and engineering numerical simulations in structural, thermal and aerodynamics.

We are currently looking for versatile developers to join MAYA Heat Transfer Technology’s Customization Services group. This group develops custom software tools and applications for MAYA’s clients in the field of engineering. The projects can cover domains as varied as geometric modeling, computer-aided manufacturing, or numerical simulations, and can be implemented using languages such as C#, Python, or C++, to name a few.

What to expect as your main responsibilities:
  • Use Agile development principles (scrum, Kanban) to develop, maintain, and integrate custom engineering software tools and products.
  • Understand client workflows, requirements, and needs, and recommend solutions and best practices.
  • Design, implement, and deploy new functionality.
  • Maintain existing products and support client requests.
  • Implement unit tests.
  • Propose and code fixes or workarounds for defects.

You will be successful in this role if you:
  • Have completed a minimum of 2 years towards an undergraduate degree in Computer Science /Engineering, or other related fields.
  • Have strong software programming skills (at least one of C#, Python, C++, VB, or Java) – familiarity with OOP is required.
  • Have excellent communication skills, both oral and written.
  • Are self-motivated.

Why join MAYA?
  • Join a high-energy and dynamic company that is a recognized industry leader.
  • Excellent training, progression and coaching provided by senior team member.
  • Great work environment with trust and autonomy, collaborative team, and regular schedule.
  • Work on various stimulating projects and on innovative technologies.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Defence
    Fixed-Term Contract / Digital
    Derby
    07/02/24
    On site

ABOUT ASSYSTEM

Please only apply for this role if you are a UK nationals and can attain a minimum level of UK security clearance of SC level.


Contracts for this role will be inside IR35.


Assystem is an international company with one mission: accelerate the energy transition around the world.


Every day, our 6,500 switchers located in 12 countries (Europe, Middle East, Pacific Asia & Africa) connect their six thousand billion neurons to tackle the task of the century: switching to low-carbon energy.


We are a collective committed to the actors who are making the energy switch. Sharing our knowledge, expertise and values allows us to innovate and think differently about the energy transition.


Drawing on more than 55 years’ experience in highly regulated sectors subject to strict security and safety requirements, we provide our customers with engineering and project management services, as well as digital services and solutions to optimize the performance of complex infrastructure projects throughout their life cycle. The Group is currently ranked second in the world for nuclear engineering.


To ensure a viable, efficient, and reliable energy future for all.


JOB DESCRIPTION

You will have proven experience architecting and designing software solutions for complex applications utilising technologies such as Python, JavaScript, SQL databases and DevOps

The Full Stack Developer functions within the Software Systems Capability department. Responsibilities include specifying, designing, validating, and testing software components, encompassing low-level requirements and source code. Ensuring on-time delivery and software quality, the engineer oversees the associated design and verification artifacts by decomposing designs, developing tests, and conducting analyses to meet specified requirements.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Reviewing and endorsing high-level software requirements, ensuring testability.
  • Analyzing and translating high-level requirements into a validated software component design.
  • Capturing design constraints and quality attributes applicable to the component.
  • Designing and implementing software components, allocating requirements to test vehicles.
  • Analyzing functional behavior through modeling and simulation, developing and reviewing software tests.
  • Analyzing verification test results against software requirements.
  • Conducting targeted testing for problem investigation, closure, and customer issues.
  • Collaborating with other disciplines to understand system components’ functional performance.
  • Participating in capacity planning and contributing to long-term strategic goals.
  • Developing, implementing, and documenting policies, procedures, guidelines, tools, and training.
  • Acquiring knowledge to provide advice to project teams and creating, searching, and reusing knowledge.
  • Producing reports to document work carried out.

MY PROFILE

Key Experiences and Qualifications:

  • Working knowledge of software design, system architecture, software/hardware development processes, and embedded software testing.
  • Familiarity with associated engineering disciplines.
  • Proficiency in design and analysis tools.
  • Professional courage to address concerns and risks related to product suitability.
  • Interpretation of test results, offering informed opinions and conclusions.
  • Task management ensuring relevant business areas are informed.
  • Risk identification and management in collaboration with team members.
  • Self-motivated with attention to detail.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, ability to understand required levels of analysis.
  • Effective time management, prioritization, and execution in a high-pressure environment.
  • Good written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Ability to communicate technical ideas in user-friendly language.
  • Research skills to seek solutions/information from external sources.
  • Team-oriented with collaborative or individual project contributions.
  • Eagerness to develop capabilities through training and workshops.
  • Ability to train others for business capability improvement and deliver training material as needed.

Due to the nature of work to be undertaken applicants will be required to be UK nationals in order to attain a minimum level of UK security clearance if not already security cleared to a minimum SC level.

We are committed to equal treatment of candidates and promote, as well as foster all forms of diversity within our company. We believe that bringing together people with different backgrounds and perspectives is essential for creating innovative and impactful solutions. Skills, talent, and our people’s ability to dare are the only things that matter !. Bring your unique contributions and help us shape the future.

We are committed to equal treatment of candidates and promote, as well as foster all forms of diversity within our company. We believe that bringing together people with different backgrounds and perspectives is essential for creating innovative and impactful solutions. Skills, talent, and our people’s ability to dare are the only things that matter !. Bring your unique contributions and help us shape the future.

title: Back End Developer
description:
About us
Campbell Scientific is internationally recognized for its expertise in weather measurements. Our products touch on a wide range of applications in the field of meteorology (aviation, energy, hydrometeorology, etc.). We provide our solutions world-wide, to customers such as national weather services, international airports and national agencies. Our solutions are a fully integrated suite of systems, from data acquisition through sensors, to end-user weather data analysis software.
Position
Join our team as a Back End Developer, take part in the design and development of weather and climate software solutions. This role will give you the opportunity to evolve in an environment filled with exciting technical challenges (networking, memory management, multithreading, data transformation, image manipulation, geo-located data, REST APIs, microservices, etc.), as well as to touch on a lot of interesting meteorology-related knowledge: weather forecast models, satellite and radar imaging, world-wide weather data exchange, climate data collection. Our NEO solution aims at being a fully integrated software solution for all those aspects.
You will work on delivering robust and reliable software applications on NEO, whilst also supporting the team when required. We work as an Agile team in which communication is essential. As a team we want to deliver the best quality. Specifically your first assignment will be delivering new features awaited by many customers, and you will also be trusted to actively contribute to our technical design process.

Some of your missions will be :
  • Collaborate actively with customer, in the context of a partnership
  • Stay up-to-date within your areas of expertise, in programming as well as in weather systems
  • Function as part of an agile team, where you can learn, and teach
  • Coordinate with other teams : Q&A testers, DevOps, Sales, Customer support
  • Gain knowledge as needed for your developments, and become the expert
  • Maintain a clear understanding of the bigger picture : the entire NEO suite
  • Ensuring compliance with security standards
About you
You have at minimum a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related, and have a minimum of 2 years of experience in software development.
Your core skills should be :
  • C++, up to modern standards
  • Go
  • SQL and relational databases
  • Code best practices
  • Autonomously organizing your work
  • Working with technical documentation
Some bonus skills could be :
  • Docker, Swarm & Kubernetes
  • Microsoft Visual Studio
  • Unit testing frameworks
  • Comfortable with CI and CD processes
  • Comfortable with DevOps platforms like Bitbucket, Gitlab, Github
  • Comfortable with Linux environments

What’s in it For You?
  • A great work culture where we work hard, and place importance on building great relationships with our peers.
  • Challenging and engaging work that makes a difference on a global scale.
  • Excellent benefits beginning on your first day with us
  • A culture which enables a balance between work and life.
We believe in working together to achieve common goals and in balancing our work life with other interests in a healthy and manageable way. We believe in removing obstacles that get in the way of developer's productivity, celebrating milestones, and finding ways to make work more fun. We select, promote, recognize, and reward our employees based on these core "ARCTIC" values:
  • Accountable – personal responsibility to honor commitments with integrity and transparency
  • Respectful – treat clients and fellow employees with trust, humility, and respect, and expect the same in return
  • Client-Centric – individual dedication to know our clients and serve our clients
  • Teamwork – work collaboratively with others to achieve our goals
  • Innovative – radically improve the client experience by applying appropriate technologies and processes
  • Continually Improving – embrace change and evolve quickly to improve what we do and how we do it
Keywords: Meteorology, Climatology, Hydrometeorology, Aeronautical meteorology, microservices, Go, C++, PostgreSQL, docker, AMQP, RabbitMQ, MongoDB, TimescaleDB

title: Back End Developer
description:
Company Description


Please only apply for this role if you are a UK nationals and can attain a minimum level of UK security clearance of SC level.

Contracts for this role will be inside IR35.

Assystem is an international company with one mission: accelerate the energy transition around the world.

Every day, our 6,500 switchers located in 12 countries (Europe, Middle East, Pacific Asia & Africa) connect their six thousand billion neurons to tackle the task of the century: switching to low-carbon energy.

We are a collective committed to the actors who are making the energy switch. Sharing our knowledge, expertise and values allows us to innovate and think differently about the energy transition.

Drawing on more than 55 years’ experience in highly regulated sectors subject to strict security and safety requirements, we provide our customers with engineering and project management services, as well as digital services and solutions to optimize the performance of complex infrastructure projects throughout their life cycle. The Group is currently ranked second in the world for nuclear engineering.

To ensure a viable, efficient, and reliable energy future for all.


Job Description


You will have proven experience architecting and designing software solutions for complex applications utilising technologies such as Python, JavaScript, SQL databases and DevOps

The Back End Developer functions within the Software Systems Capability department. Responsibilities include specifying, designing, validating, and testing software components, encompassing low-level requirements and source code. Ensuring on-time delivery and software quality, the engineer oversees the associated design and verification artifacts by decomposing designs, developing tests, and conducting analyses to meet specified requirements.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Reviewing and endorsing high-level software requirements, ensuring testability.
  • Analyzing and translating high-level requirements into a validated software component design.
  • Capturing design constraints and quality attributes applicable to the component.
  • Designing and implementing software components, allocating requirements to test vehicles.
  • Analyzing functional behavior through modeling and simulation, developing and reviewing software tests.
  • Analyzing verification test results against software requirements.
  • Conducting targeted testing for problem investigation, closure, and customer issues.
  • Collaborating with other disciplines to understand system components' functional performance.
  • Participating in capacity planning and contributing to long-term strategic goals.
  • Developing, implementing, and documenting policies, procedures, guidelines, tools, and training.
  • Acquiring knowledge to provide advice to project teams and creating, searching, and reusing knowledge.
  • Producing reports to document work carried out.

Qualifications


Key Experiences and Qualifications:

  • Working knowledge of software design, system architecture, software/hardware development processes, and embedded software testing.
  • Familiarity with associated engineering disciplines.
  • Proficiency in design and analysis tools.
  • Professional courage to address concerns and risks related to product suitability.
  • Interpretation of test results, offering informed opinions and conclusions.
  • Task management ensuring relevant business areas are informed.
  • Risk identification and management in collaboration with team members.
  • Self-motivated with attention to detail.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, ability to understand required levels of analysis.
  • Effective time management, prioritization, and execution in a high-pressure environment.
  • Good written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Ability to communicate technical ideas in user-friendly language.
  • Research skills to seek solutions/information from external sources.
  • Team-oriented with collaborative or individual project contributions.
  • Eagerness to develop capabilities through training and workshops.
  • Ability to train others for business capability improvement and deliver training material as needed.

Additional Information


Due to the nature of work to be undertaken applicants will be required to be UK nationals in order to attain a minimum level of UK security clearance if not already security cleared to a minimum SC level.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Company Description


As our Cloud Engineer, you will design, implement, maintain and provide support for our cloud-based systems and applications. You'll be responsible for ensuring that our systems are designed for high availability and performance, and are able to scale to meet the demands of our growing business. The role will require you to work part of a team in developing and maintaining our automated build and deployment processes.

Join us at Greene King the country's leading pub company and brewer, where our mission is to pour happiness into lives and become the pride of great British hospitality. We have something special, deeply rooted in our 220-year brewing and pub history, creating the business we are proudly known for today. Still today our 39,000 strong team are the guardians of what’s wholly British, the pub experience.


Additional Information


In reward for your hard work, you will receive...

A competitive salary, pension contribution as well as:

  • 33 days Holiday – With the opportunity to buy an additional 5 days!
  • Life Assurance – Up to 4 times your salary!
  • Discounted Dental & Health Insurance
  • Discount of 33% for you and 15% for your loved ones on all of our brands – so you enjoy your favourite food and drink at a discount
  • Free employee assistance program – Mental Health, well-being, Financial, and Legal support because you matter!
  • Discount of 50% for you and 25% for your loved ones at our Greene King Inns and hotels. – so, you can enjoy a weekend away without breaking the bank
  • Refer a friend – Who do you know who could be interested in a new role? When they are placed, you could earn up to £1,500 for referring them!
  • Retail discounts – Receive up to 30% of at Superdrug, exclusive discounts with Three mobile along with many more…
  • The chance to further your career across our well-known brands – As one of the industry's top apprenticeship providers, we can provide training and development at each level of your career

Job Description


In your role as Cloud engineer you will...

  • Develop and maintain Azure cloud infrastructure, including virtual networks, storage accounts, and virtual machines
  • Design and implement cloud-based solutions using Azure services such as App Services, Functions, and Logic Apps
  • Monitor and troubleshoot cloud-based applications and services, automate cloud-based deployments using Azure DevOps
  • Implement security best practices for cloud-based applications and services, design and implement cost-effective cloud-based solutions including designing and implement backup and disaster recovery solutions
  • Develop and maintain Azure automation scripts
  • Monitor and optimize cloud-based resources for performance and cost
  • Participate in the design and implementation of cloud-based solutions for customer

What you will bring....

  • Hard working with the ability to work under pressure with the self-motivation and ability to work unsupervised
  • Persistent, tenacious and diligent with keen attention to detail
  • Good customer communication skills
  • Azure Cloud Services, Azure App Services, Azure Functions, Azure Automation
  • Team Collaboration and Productivity
  • Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills

Knowledge of:

  • Cloud Infrastructure Design, Cloud-based Application Development
  • Azure Logic Apps
  • Linux and Windows Server Operating Systems
  • Software Development / Deployment pipelines
  • Development and DevOps processes
  • Web Application Firewalls
  • Azure Active Directory, Virtual Networks, Storage Accounts, Virtual Machines
  • Cloud Security Best Practices, Resource Optimization, Scalability, Performance Monitoring, Cloud-based Solution Implementation
  • Backup and Disaster Recovery
  • Team Collaboration and Productivity
  • Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills

Qualifications


Qualified in / studying towards relevant qualifications for role or equivalent

  • Microsoft Azure Fundamentals
  • Microsoft Azure Administrator
  • Microsoft Azure Architect Design
  • Microsoft Azure Architect Technologies
