title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Loughborough
E-Space UK – Engineering, Manufacturing & Operations /
Full-Time
/ On-Site

Ready to make connectivity from space universally accessible, secure and actionable? Then you’ve come to the right place!
E-Space is bridging Earth and space to enable hyper-scaled deployments of space-powered Internet of Things (IoT) solutions and services. We are fundamentally changing the design, economics, manufacturing, coverage limitations and service delivery associated with traditional satellite and terrestrial IoT systems.
By building a highly-advanced low Earth orbit (LEO) space system—with a unique antenna design, highly sustainable spacecraft system and low-cost, small portable end-user devices—we can extend global satellite coverage, capacity and connectivity beyond legacy space services to provide a new kind of IoT platform that lets users sense, track, connect and act on information gathered, anywhere.
We’re intentional, we’re unapologetically curious and we’re 100% committed to saving space, protecting our planet and turning connectivity into actionable intelligence.

What is the role:

The Senior Software Engineer will play a pivotal role in the Embedded/Platform Software department, focusing on the development of highly optimized software for novel Satellite deployments and control of small devices with multiple sensors. This individual will collaborate with a diverse team of embedded engineers, signal processing engineers, mobile app developers, and product designers to contribute to the enhancement and maintenance of existing firmware. The role involves preparing Board Support Packages, implementing Embedded Software in C/C++ and Python, and supporting ongoing and new design activities. The engineer will also engage in architecture specification, design verification, and automation test framework design, showcasing a commitment to high-quality software development.

What you will do:

    • Develop highly optimized software for embedded systems, with a focus on ARM Cortex M series processors and Linux, using programming languages such as C, C++, and Python.
    • Contribute to board-level software development using Yocto and engage in hardware development and application software development activities.
    • Interface with external sensors and devices, demonstrating a deep understanding of MCU architecture and familiarity with interfaces like UART, I2C, SPI, GPIO, and PCIe.
    • Set up toolchains and utilize source control with Git, ensuring software development meets ISO 9000 standards.
    • Collaborate in generating software requirements, developing specifications for software architecture, and contributing to the design verification and automation test framework design using Python.
    • Provide customer support by producing source code and implementation-level documentation, solving issues, and offering pre and post-sale training and technical advice.
    • Support software teams globally with embedded software development, mentor junior engineers, and actively participate as an integrated part of the platform software team during product development.
    • Review requirements documents, understand and follow schematics and circuit diagrams, and provide consultancy to sales and project architecture during product conception and enhancement.
    • Derive timescales for project delivery, manage day-to-day priorities, and demonstrate good communication skills with fluency in spoken and written English.
    • Exhibit flexibility in context switching due to multiple concurrent projects with competing resource demands.

What you bring to this role:

    • Bachelor's Degree Level in Electronics, Software Engineering, or Communications.
    • Minimum 4 years of experience in Embedded Software development.
    • Proficiency in Embedded C/C++, Yocto, setting up toolchains, and board support package development.
    • Experience in software architecture design, Linux development, and scripting workflows.
    • Familiarity with NXP Codewarrior and processors (Layerscape Access).
    • Deep understanding of MCU architecture
    • Ability to write code from data sheets
    • Experience with IDEs such as Eclipse, MPLAB, IAR, Mbed Studio, Atmel Studio, Keil
    • Knowledge of scripting language such as Python, Ruby, Perl, BASH
    • Experience with Linux kernel module development and Linux kernel driver development
    • Experience with Buildroot
    • Strong problem-solving skills, effective time management, and creative thinking in design.
    • Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with multiple global teams.

Bonus points:

    • Further tertiary education (Masters/PhD).
    • Proficiency in Python, MATLAB, VHDL/Verilog programming, and FPGA/ASIC development.
    • Expertise in embedded peripheral interfacing (UART/I2C/SPI/GPIO/PCIe).
    • Understanding of offline storage, DDR, threading, and performance tuning.
    • Experience with BLE for wireless communication.
We are doing exciting work with satellites, so candidates with and understanding or direct experience on LEO satellite component development, design and in-orbit activities will be viewed very positively.

Why E-Space is right for you:

We want you to make the most of your journey at E-Space. That’s why we support and invest in the physical, emotional and financial well-being of our team members and their families. Some of what you can expect when working at E-Space:

  • An opportunity to really make a difference
  • Sustainability at our core
  • Fair and honest workplace
  • Innovative thinking is encouraged
  • Competitive salaries
  • Continuous learning and development
  • Health and wellness care options
  • Financial solutions for the future

title: Senior Developer
description:
Epicor Senior Developer

Acro Aircraft Seating is one of the UK’s leading and fastest-growing manufacturers of passenger seats for commercial airlines around the world. We are an agile, innovative business at the forefront of disrupting the aerospace market. Through modern methodologies, lean techniques, inspired innovation, and passion for being the best, Acro is positioning itself to be the world’s leading aircraft seating supplier.

Collaboration is one of Acro’s core values, by working together and applying our skills and expertise across Sales, Engineering, Quality, Supply Chain and Operations, we find the solutions to our clients’ most complex challenges and how we deliver our promises today and tomorrow.


Location: UK
Salary: Competitive


EXCELLENT BENEFITS

  • 25 days holiday + bank holidays
  • Pension
  • Healthcare scheme
  • Life assurance
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Retail discounts
  • Training opportunities
  • 37.5 hours per week – 1 pm finish on a Friday



To be successful in this position, you will have/be;

  • Working knowledge of Service Delivery methodologies and security standards, ITIL and ISO27001
  • Good problem-solving, analytical and decision-making skills, with the ability to determine the approximate impact of each issue quickly
  • Good people (user) management and time management skills, with the ability to plan and prioritise workload
  • Knowledge of security best practices and how these can be optimised in an ERP operational environment
  • Willingness to work outside of regular UK office hours, to support maintenance requirements and to react to exceptional work requirements
  • Windows server task scheduling
  • SQL queries for generating data and reporting
  • MS SQL server management, including backup and restore, recovery models, and maintenance tasks
  • Knowledge of Epicor, including BAQs, BPMs, and Functions
  • Knowledge of Hyper-V failover clustering
  • Knowledge of server backup and restore operations including third-party tools
  • Working with 3rd parties for troubleshooting and developing solutions
  • Knowledge and experience of IT security and cyber protection. Databases, Firewalls, intrusion detection industry best practices and user support
  • SSRS report writing
  • SSMS for database management
  • Desirable programming experience with .Net
  • Understanding of multi-tiered applications
  • Knowledge of relational databases
  • Experience in developing solutions using C#, .NET and SQL Server
  • Good SQL/T-SQL skills – advanced queries, stored procedures, cursors
  • Experience with REST APIs
  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing
  • Ability to gather requirements, produce estimates, create designs
  • Skilled at producing elegant, maintainable cod
  • Experience writing functional and regression tests
  • Good at communicating (written and verbal) with Business users, other technical teams and management
  • Ability to work as part of a team, and be able to lead and mentor team members
  • Analytical thinking and creative problem-solving skills
  • Thought leader and change agent
  • Knowledge of the Epicor ERP/Kinetic Products
  • Ability to customise ERP/Kinetic – UIs, BPMs, Functions, SDK
  • Use of Epicor Administration Console
  • Experience of other Epicor Products – ECM, IDC, Quick Ship
  • Experience with SFDC, BarTender, and papercut



The Parent Company of ACRO Aircraft Seating is Zhejiang Tiancheng Controls Co., Ltd headquartered in China.

We really want to hear from you, so don’t miss your opportunity to join us! Once you apply, your CV will be held on our central database. Please do let us know if you do not wish for us to retain your details. If your application is successful, you will be contacted in due course.

Acro Aircraft Seating is an equal opportunities employer.

Please view our website for access to our Job Applicant Privacy Notice.

The closing date for applications is 23 February 2024.

Please note: This advert may close early if sufficient applications are received. Acro Aircraft Seating uses reserve lists for positions where more than one candidate is deemed suitable for a position. Reserve lists are in place for 12 months, during which time reserve candidates may be offered the same or similar post should one become available.

title: Desktop Support Technician
description:
We're looking for someone to be the go-to person for help - you will be responsible for communication between our customers and our company and helping them with any software issues. An understanding of technology and the ability to build strong friendly relationships is essential for this role.

Viva IT is an innovative software development company. We specialise in fintech and banking software to a small number of clients around the UK. We're fully remote, but generally based around Leicestershire and the East Midlands.

We believe there are just a few simple things needed to create great careers: great technology, a great working environment, and most importantly great people around you.

We're looking for people who share our passion for quality software. Ultimately, we want people who have a compulsion to solve problems, love being around like-minded people, thrive at being challenged, and most of all people who just have a passion for the work. People just like us.

Essential Requirements

  • Provide technical support and assistance to our customers via phone, email, or chat
  • Troubleshoot and resolve desktop/laptop hardware and software issues for our customers
  • Help our internal staff with issues
  • Install, configure, and maintain computer hardware and software systems
  • Learn and understand our bespoke software and provide assistance to our clients
  • Collaborate with our software developers, third-party technical teams and vendors to resolve issues
  • Document customer interactions and resolutions in a ticketing system
  • Update documentation including configuration documents, access logs, schedules and other documentation to operate within an ISO 27001 compliant framework (data security)
  • Assist with network troubleshooting and maintenance
  • Conduct system upgrades and patch management with effectiveness reporting
  • Operate effectively within an SLA framework
  • Provide training and guidance to customers on the use of software applications

Skills:

  • Strong knowledge of computer hardware, software, and networking principles
  • Experience with firewall configuration and management
  • Excellent customer service skills with the ability to communicate technical information effectively
  • Proficiency in Windows operating systems
  • Knowledge / proficiency in Microsoft Cloud services (Entra, InTune)
  • Knowledge and experience in Google Workspace
  • Familiarity with YouTrack or other ticketing systems
  • Ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues related to LAN/WAN connectivity, VPNs, and remote access
  • Knowledge of IT support best practices and methodologies
  • Experience in desktop support and troubleshooting

Experience Required

  • In this role, you are expected to be bringing in significant experience from previous roles backed with professional qualifications.
  • At least 2 years experience in the field.

Useful Skills

  • Specification capture

Working Hours

  • 8-hour shifts (40 hour per week)
  • Typically Monday - Friday 0900 - 1730, with occasional weekend with flexibility (covering)
  • Shift flexibility depending on cover available i.e. 0800 - 16:30, 0900 - 17:30, 1130 - 2000

Career Progression

  • £1,500/year available for continuous professional development.
  • Opportunity to be around software developers in a fast paced environment (if you are looking for skill transfer)

Remote Work

The COVID-19 lockdowns accelerated our plans to become a remote-first company. Our team has transitioned fully to fully remote and there are no plans to return to the office. We heavily use remote collaboration tools. Although the path to remote-first includes an international team and no restrictions on working times, we're not quite ready for this yet.

It is critical that:

  • You have a quiet and comfortable location where you can work from home, equipment can be provided.
  • You can travel occasionally (2-4 times a year) to a location in the East Midlands, UK.
  • You can work typical office times 09:00 to 17:30 (we've not transitioned to full flexible working)
  • Must be based in the UK permanently.

Visa/Sponsorships

We are not licensed to sponsor a visa and we have no immediate plans to register for a license.

Eligibility to work in the UK

Please ensure that you are eligible to work in the United Kingdom before you apply without a time limited visa.

Recruiters

We do not work with recruiters in any capacity. Please do not call us or send unsolicited CV's.

Location

Although we have a remote team, we do occasionally meet up for social or business critical kick-off meetings. It is important that you can occasionally travel to these venues which will be based around the East Midlands.

Job Directory Websites

If you came to this page via another recruitment website or job directory, please be advised that if you submit your information through this job directory channel, you might not get a response.

Applying

If you're interested, please send us anything you'd like us to take a look at such as your CV, cover letter, links to your personal website, portfolios or GitHub to careers@vivait.co.uk.

Grow with us. Help us to succeed, and we'll help you to succeed.

If you have a further enquiry that might not be answered on this page, or you would like to apply for a role on our careers page, it is crucial that you contact us via our email address. We will not be able to help via the telephone. Any messages sent to our careers email address will be picked up by a member of our team.

title: Developer
description:
We have a market leading opportunity for a skilled Blockchain Developer to undertake a vital role in an exciting New Blockchain Network.
My client is looking for a Blockchain Developer who will be responsible for designing and implementing a blockchain-based network.
The initial project is for 18 months, but there will be ongoing long term projects for Developers who impress with their work.
The primary responsibility will be analyzing requirements, designing blockchain technology around the client's business model, and the building and launching of a blockchain network.
Key Requirments and duties:
- Research, design, develop, and test blockchain technologies.
- Strong software development background experience working with large codebases.
- Familiarity with basic cryptography.
- Strong knowledge of common algorithms and data structures.
- Familiarity with P2P networks.
- Strong knowledge of bitcoin-like blockchains.
- Strong knowledge of concurrency and writing efficient and safe multithreaded code.
- Experience working with open-source projects in one or several of the following languages: C++, Java, JavaScript.
Benefits:
- Salary up to £150,000 pounds per annum plus expenses.
- Remote working
- No set hours
- Not Micromanaged
- Be involved in the global blockchain community—work on implementing and integrating the latest improvement proposals.
If you fit the brief we would love to hear from you, click apply, and one of our consultants will be in touch within 24 hours.
Alternatively, feel free to contact Michael on 07503224505 to discuss in more depth.
Thanks to all that apply.

The primary responsibility will be analyzing requirements, designing blockchain technology around the client's business model, and the building and launching of a blockchain network.
Key Requirments and duties:
- Research, design, develop, and test blockchain technologies.
- Strong software development background experience working with large codebases.
- Familiarity with basic cryptography.
- Strong knowledge of common algorithms and data structures.
- Familiarity with P2P networks.
- Strong knowledge of bitcoin-like blockchains.
- Strong knowledge of concurrency and writing efficient and safe multithreaded code.
- Experience working with open-source projects in one or several of the following languages: C++, Java, JavaScript.
Benefits:
- Salary up to £150,000 pounds per annum plus expenses.
- Remote working
- No set hours
- Not Micromanaged
- Be involved in the global blockchain community—work on implementing and integrating the latest improvement proposals.
If you fit the brief we would love to hear from you, click apply, and one of our consultants will be in touch within 24 hours.
Alternatively, feel free to contact Michael on 07503224505 to discuss in more depth.
Thanks to all that apply.

title: Software Engineer
description:
A market leader in the development and provision of Retail software environments, addressing single or multi-Retail operations, for specialist Distribution, Wholesale, Merchant, and Retail industry sectors, addressing single or multi-branch operations, as well as catering for organisations with 'point-of-sale' showrooms and warehouses, currently has a position available for an experienced senior or lead Software Engineer.

Main Duties and Responsibilities

  • Deal with multiple concurrent projects, prioritising and resolving conflicting demands as required.
  • Collaborate on development objectives and initiate action toward meeting them.
  • Ensure that all work is implemented to specification, on schedule, with good quality and within the effort estimated.
  • Monitor on-going progress and report on exceptions to project and team management
  • Ensure KCS programming standards, best practice and industry guidelines are adhered to
  • This role will involve development of applications, and delivering fixes for customers
  • Carry out programming tasks from specifications against specific project timescales
  • Conduct unit testing on own code
  • Submit code for peer review and make modifications in line with feedback received
  • Participate in peer review of code and specification, making suggestions to increase quality
  • Schedule own time to deliver against assigned priorities in line with agreed project timescales
  • Provide clear updates on progress against assigned tasks
  • Escalate problems and exceptions that need to be addressed in a timely manner, with suggested solutions and workarounds
  • Mentor other members of the development team

Skills, Knowledge and Experience

  • Extensive programming experience in .NET
  • Requires a good understanding SQL database design and query design
  • C# and web-based programming skills
  • Must be comfortable been able understand use VB.NET for supporting some older components and services
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Project Management/Or Agile development skills and experience of having delivered software projects to specification, on time and of good quality
  • Knowledge of industry standard methodologies, tools and processes for software development
  • Knowledge of software project lifecycles
  • Knowledge of development tools and modern database technologies
  • Good general management skills in a fast-paced technical operation
  • Empathy with software QA and QC processes
  • Has a passion for architecting and writing proficient clean code
  • Ability to mentor and support more inexperienced team members
  • A good understanding/experience of some or all of the following: .NET, ASP.NET, VB.NET, C#, .NET Core, JavaScript
  • Use of ALM tools such as Azure Devops, including boards, pipelines and artifacts or equivalent products
  • Drive collaboration and high standards through collaborative code reviews
  • A passion and drive for clean, automated delivery processes
  • Experience and exposure to Microsoft Azure:
    • Web Apps
    • Storage
    • Azure Sql
    • Cosmos Db

Equal Opportunities

KCS Group is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity.

Development Team

  • Operates a hybrid modal of working: 3 days in and 2 days at home.
  • Have full access to development server and work with other team members on code merge
  • Assist QA staff members on testing and documentation
  • Assist with software releases
  • Assist support members with customer queries

Health and Safety

The Health and Safety at Work Act 1974 puts a legal obligation on KCS as an employer to ensure, so far as is reasonably practicable, the health, safety and welfare of its employees at work.

Employees also have a duty to take reasonable care for their own health and safety and of others who could be affected by their actions. Understanding the safety policies and co-operating with the arrangements that are in place is therefore an essential part of your employment.

title: Apprentice Data Centre Engineer Data Infrastructure
Apprentice Data Centre Engineer Data Infrastructure
Senior Developer
description:
Job Title: Senior C# Developer, Web Applications

My client, an esteemed innovator in the hospitality technology sector, is on the hunt for a proficient Senior C# Developer. This exciting opportunity based in Derby involves the creation of high-performing web applications, interfaces, and APIs.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a candidate who thrives in a team-oriented environment, is driven by producing quality work, and has a proven track record in C# development. The ideal candidate will be excited about the complexities and rewards that come with crafting solutions from high-level user requirements and liaising with other team members.

Key responsibilities and requirements:
  • Exceptional C# development proficiency and comprehensive understanding of its fundamental principles.
  • Advanced T-SQL skills.
  • A minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience with .net Frameworks.
  • Sound understanding of object-oriented programming.
  • Experience with Visual Studio.
  • Proficient understanding of REST APIs.
  • Track record of full application development lifecycle.
  • Eagerness to acquire new development skills and stay abreast of the latest technologies.

Bonus qualifications (but not mandatory):
  • Familiarity with Amazon Web Services (AWS).
  • Experience with Git source control.
  • Our client encourages self-motivation, enjoys the thrill of tackling challenges, and savours the independence that comes with designing solutions.

What you can expect…

My client firmly believes that a happy workplace yields fantastic outcomes. Hence, they invest in their people, offering:
  • Unparalleled training and development opportunities.
  • A relaxed dress code, promoting casual comfort.
  • Regular social events to foster team cohesion.

Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity to join a collaborative and dynamic team. Ignite your passion for technology while working on exciting projects and develop your career with an industry leader. Apply now!

title: Senior Application Engineer
description:
Nuneaton
£50k - 59k per year
Permanent

Application Software Engineer (Transmission Systems)

BRIEF OVERVIEW
– Role: Application Software Engineer (mid/senior and Principal/lead available)
– Location: Warwickshire
– Role type: Permanent
– Salary: up to £59k DOE

Recruit 12 has an exciting opportunity for an Application Software Engineer with a business which is focusing heavily on electrification of various types of mobility.

You’ll be focusing on application-level software for high performance applications and is based in a modern facility, offering a fast-paced and challenging environment to make big steps forward in the field of advanced engineering.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
– Be part of an experienced team
– Deliver application software for various projects
– Be involved in complete architectures and interfaces
– Look into areas such as transmission control
– Be involved in implementing requirements
– Work from design to production
– Support commissioning and debugging
– Be involved with verification, validation and testing

REQUIRED SKILLS
– MATLAB/Simulink (or similar such as Ascet-D)
– Communication protocol knowledge (such as CAN, J1939, XCP, etc)
– Calibration tools such as CANape or similar
– Knowledge of transmission, gearbox or powertrain control knowledge

DESIRABLE (NOT ESSENTIAL)
– Functional safety knowledge
– Vehicle and/or test-rig based development
– Degree in a relevant engineering discipline

Recruit12 is a recruitment specialist, working within the Automotive, Advanced Engineering, Nuclear Industry, Renewable Energy and Construction sectors

title: Software Engineer
description:
Location: flexible (remote/home working supported – head office Kent)
Contract: Permanent
Technology stack: .NET Core 6.0, SQL, Azure, JavaScript, ECMAScript/TypeScript Angular/Material

“You love solving problems, creating code, engaging with users and thrive on challenge. You are looking for an opportunity to have impact, and to drive forward your knowledge of the latest technology stacks.”

Our client is an established business specialising in the provision of integrated security management solutions. The business is investing to build an in-house software development capability, so this is your opportunity to play a pivotal role in designing and building new software products (using the latest development languages and frameworks).

You are likely to be a ‘full-stack’ developer, with some areas of specialism. You will need to be ambitious and driven and have a desire to immerse yourself in both technology and the human side of the business.

Working collaboratively with the directors, you will:
  • understand the company's growth strategy, and contribute to product design;
  • assist with architecture specification and technology selection.

Your responsibilities will include:
  • writing efficient and maintainable code;
  • ensuring best-practice DevOps processes are followed;
  • ensuring quality is built into the company's products and contributing to QA processes;
  • ensuring that best-practice UX principles are adhered to;
  • keeping abreast of technology.

As the company's development capacity increases, you will have the opportunity to provide technical leadership, supporting more junior developers.

Benefits:
  • Be part of a friendly, dynamic, and ambitious business.
  • Remote / home working if desired (head office is in Dartford, Kent).
  • 10% time for side projects / keeping up with new technologies.
  • Mentoring from experienced CTO.
  • Normal company benefits.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Are you a Software professional with a background in DSP and have exposure to developing 5G applications?

If so I'd like to speak with you!

A well-established R&D organisation who are also a market leader, are looking to rapidly expand their engineering team and as such are seeking an Embedded Software Engineer to join their development team near Loughborough, Leicestershire.
As an Embedded Software Engineer you will have a background in Digital Signal Processing and a working knowledge of communications systems engineering. To successful candidate for the Embedded Software Engineer job will have a mixture of embedded/bare metal experience alongside an understanding of implementing communication signal processing algorithms such as DDCs, filters, FFTs.

Skills/Experience required for the Embedded Software Engineer Engineer job include:
  • BEng/BSc or MSc/Meng within Engineering (Ideally Electronics, Telecommunication or similar)
  • Experience in DSP Algorithm simulation and 5G development
  • Experience in Bare Metal/ Embedded C
  • Experience with RF a bonus

Experience of the following would be advantageous:
  • Cross compilers (C++ ARM cross-compiler GCC Version 4.3.3)
  • FreeRTOS experience
  • Experience with typical embedded control peripherals (i.E. RAM, Flash, UART, PWM, A/D, CAN, I2C and SPI)
  • Cortex M3/M4 Microcontrollers or similar.
  • Experience of efficient implementation of communications DSP algorithms (such as FFT, filtering DDC etc.) In VHDL

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a well-established, highly profitable company investing heavily in R&D. This is a great chance for a Embedded Software Engineer to join a consistently growing technology company offering great training and career progression opportunities.
To apply for the Embedded Software Engineer job please send your CV to lphillips@redlinegroup.Com or for further information, call Lewis Phillips on 01582 878 880 otherwise we always welcome the opportunity to discuss other engineering jobs.

title: Front End Developer
description:
Green Shoots Recruitment Ltd is looking for a passionate, seasoned and devoted Senior Front End Developer who is excited by the art of the possible within web with excellent skills to join the talented team of designers across multiple disciplines. You’ll be ambitious, keen to work collaboratively with a team of creatives and committed to developing your skillset and the teams around you.

As a Senior Front End Developer, you would be responsible for delivering creative for clients and internal audiences. Your involvement is critical in all phases of the web design process, particularly concept development, production and product development. You will work closely alongside our existing designers, Technical Lead and Project Managers assisting them in innovating, leading and managing, our web development offerings.

As Senior Front End Developer, with a number of years’ experience, you will be required to showcase a strong portfolio of website design and development work in order to be considered for this role. Please provide a link to your portfolio or relevant work you have produced.

Senior Front End Developer Responsibilities include:

  • Design/Creative Responsibilities

  • Working closely with the creatives to design and build compelling, high-quality websites and immersive experiences

  • Meticulous QA and review of final output before presenting to the Creative Lead for client send-off

  • Managing and leading projects from brief to delivery, delegating where necessary whilst ensuring the Creative Lead/Project Lead is kept informed of the status of projects

  • Utilising conceptual and design skills to bring ideas to life and define an artistic direction

  • Shaping the details of projects by providing cutting-edge techniques and technologie

Interpersonal Responsibilities

  • Working with the wider team to innovate the web department

  • Confidently pitching ideas to clients during calls/workshops

  • Defining timescales and project milestones

  • Being involved in and potentially leading ideation sessions with the rest of the team.

  • Training team members in production best practices to support collaboration

General Responsibilities

  • Managing deadlines and ensuring projects are delivered on time

  • Being observant of the needs and behaviours of staff members both within the web team and the broader company

  • Staying current with production tools and technological advancement.

The successful Senior Front End Developer must be proficient with:

  • HTML5, SCSS, JavaScript (ES6)

  • Modern Javascript framework of your choice (React/Vue) – not essential but desirable

  • WebGL competency (Three.js) – not essential but desirable

  • Competency with CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap

  • Familiarity with WordPress

  • CSS methodologies such as BEM

  • Version control (Git)

  • Build tools/package managers such as Webpack

  • Understanding of web accessibility (WCAG 2.1)

  • Ability to comfortably manage, maintain and deploy websites across various hosting providers.

  • Familiarity with the entire web development lifecycle (UX -> Deployment)

  • Comfortable working with designers/project managers and the wider team

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Act as a consultant to direct how we approach the development stage of projects

Desirable skills for the Senior Front End Developer

  • UX/UI experience

  • Ability and confidence to be involved in the design stage (Adobe / Figma)

  • Familiarity and experience of SEO

  • PHP / WordPress development (ACF)

  • Experience in working with Jamstack

Benefits:

  • Flexible working hours

  • Remote working

  • Competitive salary and opportunities for business trips

  • Paid overtime

  • The option to convert overtime into ‘owed time’ or into extra holiday entitlement

  • Tailored packages to each employee’s wants or needs

  • Unlimited career progression and freedom to shape your role

  • Inspire afternoons and outings, including regular staff parties!

  • Free fruit and unlimited beverages

  • High-spec equipment

  • Monthly prizes and weekly opportunities for a lie-in

  • Comfy communal area and breakout spaces

Don’t forget to send links to your portfolio of Website design and development showcasing your very best work alongside your CV.

title: .NET Developer
description:
Our client is looking to recruit a mid-level C# developer with at least 3 years of experience to work across the full stack of their cashless payment solution .NET estate. As part of the Technology & Innovation (T&I) team, you will work with developers, product specialists and support teams to maintain and make improvements to the solution. The position will be based in Nottingham with 2 days in the office.
Our client creates connected digital experiences for retail & hospitality. They help brands implement end-to-end hospitality & retail technology solutions to improve their customer journeys & drive productivity gains within their operations.

Their platform is being used by some of the world’s largest enterprises such as; M&S, Waitrose, Morrisons, John Lewis and many more.

Their core technology covers innovations in self-service, self-order, digital ordering, kitchen automation, transactional payment solutions, epos, inventory & analytics.

Job Description
Our client is looking for a confident individual who will take ownership of software components across the full stack, designing, writing code, and driving engineering best practices. You will be in work on resolving the root cause of endemic problems, identifying team or delivery bottlenecks, seeking out improved operational excellence approaches to the services you operate. You will code features, test them, deploy, and support them.

What you will be doing
  • Scoring development tickets from the product backlog and roadmap.
  • Developing hospitality & retail technology solutions including:
    • Self Order Kiosk Software
    • Self Checkout Software
    • EPOS Software
    • Mobile Order & Pay Software
    • Digital Wallets
    • Menu Management Software
    • Associated Databases
    • API platforms
  • Integrations to other systems.
  • Completing allocated points within a given sprint.
  • Participating in sprint planning and retros.
  • Interacting with Q&A to ensure development tickets are released without defects.
  • Interpreting user stories and product requirements from Product team and external clients or prospects.
  • Handling builds and deployment across the development lifecycle.
  • Assisting the business & directors with other tasks wherever reasonably required.

What we need from you

Essential:
  • C# (.NET Framework AND .NET Core)
  • HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • MS SQL
  • Rest API development experience (C#)
  • MVC and ASP.NET experience (C#)
  • Understanding of Agile methodologies
  • Experience using Git for source control

Desirable:
  • Java experience
  • React experience
  • React Native experience
  • Angular experience
  • C++ experience
  • Experience working with Azure
  • Experience supporting a Cloud based EPOS system or similar industry experience

Qualifications

Degree in computer science, engineering, or related discipline

What benefits does our client offer?
  • Competitive salary depending on experience
  • Health & Pension Scheme
  • 25 days Holiday plus 8 statutory bank holidays
  • On the tram line from Nottingham City Centre/Free Parking
  • Flexible start and finish time / office working
  • Fortnightly team events with food and drinks

description:

description:

title: Software Engineer
description:
An enthusiastic developer looking for a career in a fast-growing software company is required. Being a little crazy about software and technology would be a real advantage - we are! title: Database Developer
description:
• Job Reference: NJ0149
  • Date Posted: 9 February 2024
  • Recruiter: Nexus Jobs
  • Location: Coventry
  • Salary: £45,000 to £60,000
  • Sector: I.T. & Communications
  • Job Type: Permanent
  • Work Hours: Full Time
  • Contact: Jas Gujral
  • Email: cv@nexusjobs.com
  • Telephone: 020 7488 6900

Job Description

Database Developer with TeraData - Coventry

Our Client is looking to recruit a Tera Data Developer with at least 5 years hands-on experience in data analysis, data modeling & SQL writing in Teradata Environment.

Must have strong knowledge in Teradata Architecture. (Must have knowledge on Journal, RAID, CLIQUE,FALLBACK mechanism)

Good understanding and working knowledge of ALL SQL functions, Join strategies (HASH, MARGE etc.)

Understanding and working knowledge of all System tables such as DBQL, PDCRINFO etc

Hands on knowledge on Teradata PL/SQL, Store Procedure, Ref Cursor etc

With very good hands on knowledge on Teradata SQL, BTEQ, Fastload, Multiload, TPUMP, TPT skill

Complete understanding of Performance Tuning technique, working with SKEWNESS, SPACE MANAGING, LOCKING

Understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) & Data Warehousing Concepts

Should have knowledge on Data Profiling activities

Should have knowledge on Teradata Viewpoint portlets, alert mechanism etc

With excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with quick adaptation to new technologies, methodologies, and system

Good individual contributor as well as a team player with ability to build strong partner confidence

Excellent communication skills and judgment, ability to manage multiple tasks, and work towards a deadline in a fast paced, aggressive development schedule

Ability to work in any Shift (24x7)

Tera Data, DWBi Concepts, Data Modeling, Development, SQL & analytics.

Salary for this role is negotiable but will be in the range £45K to £60K.

Please send your CV to us in Word format.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Brief Description

Pektron Group Ltd is searching for an Embedded Software Engineer who will be responsible for writing software for a range of bespoke products.
Our team:
Our Engineering attitude is confident and “can do” and with solid research and a lot of intuition we nearly always succeed.
Nearly all of our code is written in C, mainly because it’s the most widely available language for the variety of 8, 16, 32 bit micros we use on our boards and we’re good at it! We pride ourselves on efficient reliable software and we mix our hardware and software teams together so that we can get the most out of our micros and we get it right first time. All of our code is collaboratively developed with our peers, so you get to learn from the people that know that technology best.
We are geeks and proud! We love engineering and our lunchtime conversations are made up of 3D printing, power generation, hyper cars (we sometimes get to play with these), electric vehicles (we’ve worked on some of these too) and any other areas of science and technology.
Last year we started developing our Application code using model based design using the Matlab toolchain, allowing us to spend less time on coding and more time thinking about good quality architecture and design and let the tools (when driven correctly) do the coding! Obviously, there’s always plenty of code to be written and we continue to do low and middle level software the traditional way.
You:
You will be a highly motivated and self-managing Embedded Software Engineer with preferably the experience of working in a customer facing, commercial environment. You will have a highly developed, structured approach to design and the ability to compose a design rationale, along with good technical writing skills and a willingness to work within our collaboratively developed software design ethics and style.
The role:
You will be working within the Software Development Team which is part a multi-disciplined engineering team, consisting of Mechanical, Electronic and Firmware Engineers (approx. 60 in total). New business is primarily focussed in the high performance and luxury car markets; however Pektron designs and manufactures a wide range of products for Gas, Automotive, Safety and Consumer industries. You will have the opportunity to write software for interesting and diverse projects as well as specify tools, requirements and drive the software discipline within the company, and to be involved in every aspect of the product lifecycle from quotation, concept, design, and validation through to manufacture.
Recent projects include:
Design and manufacture of advanced body control systems including passive keys and active suspension systems for high performance vehicles.
Developing advanced instrument clusters, passive entry systems, body and chassis control systems for major OEM clients in the automotive, agricultural and construction sectors.
Experience and skills required:
Exceptional Fault Diagnosis and Analysis
Embedded Programing in C
Version Control
Static Analysis / Code Metrics
Microprocessors 8, 16 & 32 bit
Low Level Drivers for External Hardware / CPU Peripherals or Embedded Application Development
Communication – Spoken/Written/Technical English must be of a minimum of IELTS 7 or SELT B1
Additional points that would be an advantage
Knowledge of Real Time Control
Experience of Software Architecture and Detailed Design
Ability to travel freely (some customers are based in US / EU)
Familiarity of working within MISRA C rules
Working experience of AUTOSAR architecture
Programing: Windows/Linux, Visual Basic, C++, high level structured languages
Simple Electronic Design: Analogue / Digital
Control of Graphic Displays
Communications Protocols: Serial, CAN, LIN, Diagnostic, Ethernet
Use Vector Vehicle Networking Tools such as CANoe/CANalyser
Design / Modelling experience (For example: UML, Matlab, Simulink, Rhapsody or Targetlink)
Experience of Graphics Processors & Driving TFT displays
Knowledge of CMMI / SPICE / ASPICE process frameworks
Practical experience of working to ISO26262 ASIL-B or similar

What’s on offer:

Competitive salaries

Flexible Home/On site working

Yearly pay review

25 days holiday plus bank holidays

Pension

Free parking

Free tea & coffee

BUPA healthcare

Life Insurance

Cycle to work scheme

Funding for professional training and further education plus support in attaining professional membership and paid membership fees

39 hour working week with flexible start and finish times

For candidates interested in relocating to the area we can assist with relocation costs and we are able to offer Skilled worker sponsorship for candidates who meet all our criteria.

Location:

We are based in Alfreton Road in Derby, easily commutable from the Derby area, Nottingham, Mansfield, Burton, Loughborough, Ashbourne and the Peak District and East Staffordshire.

We have 5 modern, purpose built buildings at our Derby site including state of the art manufacturing facilities and a purpose built Engineering centre to house our Engineering team. Our facilities have been recognised as being one of the most modern and well equipped electronics design, development and manufacturing plants in Europe.

If you are considering relocation, Derby has been rated as the best City in the UK for disposable income and Derbyshire is listed in the top 10 places to live in the UK. Alternatively we are happy to discuss partial remote / flexible working options.

Pektron are one of the largest privately owned electronics manufacturers in the world with over 50 years’ experience delivering bespoke electronics hardware and software solutions to blue-chip companies globally. We are innovators in our field and invest in the best people, processes and equipment to drive technological development and meet our customer’s needs.
At our HQ in Derby we employ 300 staff and operate Engineering, Manufacturing, Design, Testing, Quality and Support functions, whilst our Sales and Technology centre in Detroit supports our customers in the US.
Our group of companies also includes Bee Lighting Ltd who were founded in 2006 and have developed into a leading supplier of design services to the Automotive Lighting Industry. Bee design & manufacture bespoke lighting solutions for some of the most prestigious OEM’s from around the World, taking concepts from initial sketches through to full production designs. Their stylish lighting creations can be found on some of the world’s leading automotive brands.
Based in Redditch Bee employ 50 people, including highly skilled and imaginative Lighting specialists, Electronics Engineers, Design Engineers and Manufacturing staff plus administrative support functions.

To find out more about this vacancy, please call 01332 832424 or email your CV directly

title: Back End Developer
description:
Your attitude, potential and passion is what matters. Work inside a talented development team, you will be expected to produce well tested code to a tight acceptance criteria.

Viva IT is an innovative and exciting fintech. We specialise in creating mobile app and web-based financial software. Although we have a fully remote workforce, we are centred in the East Midlands, UK.

We believe there are just a few simple things needed to create great software: state of the art technology, a continuously delivering pipeline of code, a purpose, a relaxed working environment, and most importantly a like minded team of people.

We take an hybrid-agile approach to product development, forgoing the traditional vertical structure of management, meaning that even our newest developers will be given opportunities and encouraged to lead and learn.

We're looking for software engineers who share our passion for code. We're primarily a PHP team, but we're strong believers that language doesn't matter - the kind of software engineer we're looking for will be able to create magic, regardless of the language however previous experience in our tools will be a bonus.

We use an array of tools, technologies and frameworks including:

  • PHP 8.2
  • Symfony LTS releases including: 5.4 and 6.4
  • MySQL
  • React
  • Javascript
  • PHPUnit
  • Git & GitHub
  • YouTrack
  • TeamCity
  • PHPStorm

Exposure to these tools is always favourable, but as an engineer we're sure you'll relish the opportunity to learn new technology and use new tools. We release multiple times a day through a fully automated release pipeline, this is development in the fast lane and there is no room to dawdle.

Ultimately, we want people who have a compulsion to solve problems, that thrive at being challenged, crave knowledge, aspire to be the best, a desire to deliver value, and most of all, people who have a real passion for the work. People just like us.

Requirements

  • A BSc/MSc in a relevant field such as computer science, software engineering, etc.
  • or 2 years of relevant industry experience in commercial software development.

Our ideal candidate would have:

  • 2 years of commercial Programming experience, ideally in PHP.
  • Great understanding of object-oriented design and patterns.
  • First-hand experience in creating database driven applications.
  • Extensive experience in version control systems, particularly Git.
  • A good understanding of web application security.
  • A good understanding of software testing.
  • A passion for open-source technology.

What is the work like?

For an insight into what is like working as a software developer at Viva IT, take a look at some blogs from other developers:

  • A year with Viva IT by Sophie
  • A month with Viva IT by Joe
  • Four years with Viva IT by Kane
  • Things I wish I'd known before starting at Viva IT by Leighton

Salary

Starting salary is negotiated based on previous experience with annual reviews. However indicative bands are below, depending on relevant acedemic background and commercial experience.

  • Graduate without commercial experience (BSc Hons): £25k
  • Graduate with 2y commercial experience: £25k-35k
  • 2-4y relevant experience: £35k-48k
  • 5y+ relevant experience: £48k+

We consider all experience and acedemic achievements.

Remote Work

The COVID-19 lockdowns accelerated our plans to become a remote-first company. Our team has transitioned fully to fully remote and there are no plans to return to the office. We heavily use remote collaboration tools. Although the path to remote-first includes an international team and no restrictions on working times, we're not quite ready for this yet.

It is critical that:

  • You have a quiet and comfortable location where you can work from home, equipment can be provided.
  • You can travel occasionally (2-4 times a year) to a location in the East Midlands, UK.
  • You can work typical office times 09:00 to 17:30 (we've not transitioned to full flexible working)
  • Must be based in the UK permanently.

Visa/Sponsorships

We are not licensed to sponsor a visa and we have no immediate plans to register for a license.

Eligibility to work in the UK

Please ensure that you are eligible to work in the United Kingdom before you apply without a time limited visa.

Recruiters

We do not work with recruiters in any capacity. Please do not call us or send unsolicited CV's.

Location

Although we have a remote team, we do occasionally meet up for social or business critical kick-off meetings. It is important that you can occasionally travel to these venues which will be based around the East Midlands.

Job Directory Websites

If you came to this page via another recruitment website or job directory, please be advised that if you submit your information through this job directory channel, you might not get a response.

Applying

If you're interested, please send us anything you'd like us to take a look at such as your CV, cover letter, links to your personal website, portfolios or GitHub to careers@vivait.co.uk.

Grow with us. Help us to succeed, and we'll help you to succeed.

If you have a further enquiry that might not be answered on this page, or you would like to apply for a role on our careers page, it is crucial that you contact us via our email address. We will not be able to help via the telephone. Any messages sent to our careers email address will be picked up by a member of our team.

title: .NET Developer
description:

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL:

If this position is of interest, please submit a copy of your CV in Word format, outlining your salary expectations.

Alternatively, if you are unavailable, would you be open to exploring 250* pounds referral fee for 10 minutes' work? I will offer you 250 pounds worth of shopping vouchers of your choice upon successful placement of that individual. Do you know good VB.Net Software Developer(s)?

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
About Us

We're an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we've been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world's leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.

In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen's Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.

Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.

We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!

About the Role

We love to experiment with the latest tools, technologies and techniques to improve how we deliver our solutions and as a software engineer you can expect to be involved in:

  • Engineering software solutions - working with prototypes and proof of concepts and developing fully functioning applications based on frameworks such as .Net and Spring/Spring Boot, and using languages including Java, Scala, JavaScript, Python, C# and Go.
  • Producing rich front-end UI and efficient services with technologies like React, Angular and Vue.
  • The automation of environmental and application deployment, scaling, and management using Kubernetes, Terraform, both in the cloud (AWS, Azure or GCP) or on-premise.

About You

  • You're an engineer at heart and enjoy the challenge of building complex software solutions
  • You want to work across a range of tech environments. Your priorities will be building new systems and improving stability, security and efficiency
  • You're keen to learn new technologies and languages
  • You're comfortable operating in an Agile environment with a good working knowledge in areas such as CI/CD, build pipelines, testing and architecture
  • You have a good understanding of computing fundamentals (e.g. logic, data structures, algorithms, low-level architecture, networks stack) along with strong software design skills, including OO, and knowledge of version control systems such as Git
  • You love nothing more than grabbing a pen and whiteboarding the next challenge

Some of the Perks

  • Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
  • Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
  • Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
  • Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
  • Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
  • An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
  • Flexible holiday buy/sell option
  • Electric vehicle scheme
  • Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O'Reilly
  • Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
  • You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
  • We have a busy social calendar that you can chose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
  • GymFlex gym membership programme

title: Software Engineer
description:
Cordius is the exclusive recruitment partner to a leading privately owned Research & Development organisation in Derby. Their multi-disciplined experts have a significant track record in applied solution engineering, designing and developing cutting edge technology products.


They have the strategic objective of assisting the UK to develop world class Cyber solutions and you will join a successful and highly motivated R&D team with a passion for new technologies creating unique, leading edge, embedded technology of the highest standard.


Most suited to Embedded Software Engineers with 2 years post grad industry experience this is a superb opportunity to become a part of a rapidly growing company supporting the UK Crypto industry.


You will be responsible for developing innovative products and systems and must be able to demonstrate strong design and coding skills, with a desire to explore ideas and, above all, have a passion for quality. You will have the ability to work in a team and on your own initiative, have an eye for detail and be good at identifying problems whilst suggesting prospective solutions.


Responsibilities:


  • Analysis of customer requirements to produce maintainable designs.
  • Developing and delivering work to schedule.
  • Participating in code and documentation reviews.
  • Providing estimates for tasks.
  • Providing input to technical authors producing documentation.
  • Working with support engineers on customer issues.
  • Performing third party software integrations.


Required Skills:


  • Embedded Software Engineering with C, C++ experience (1-2 years post-graduation).
  • Minimum 2:1 1st degree in Computer Science or equivalent STEM subject.
  • Practical experience of defensive programming techniques, and the application of coding standards, (MISRA or similar quality source code conformance specification).
  • Some experience of Software modelling techniques, static, dynamic analysis, code coverage and software configuration management.
  • Good written and oral communication skills with a diagnostic approach.
  • Ability to obtain/maintain a (UKIC) Security Check (DV) without restrictions.


Desirable Skills:


  • Can demonstrate a breadth of software engineering experience spanning bare metal, and a variety of Multi-Threaded Real Time Operating Systems across a diverse range of processor types. Scope of experience (ideally) to include Board Support Packages and MMU integration and (ideally) familiarity with Trusted Execution Environments.
  • Proficiency with scripting languages such as Ruby, Groovy, Python, Perl and Bash.
  • Practical experience of network security and vulnerability analysis including Fuzzing technique.
  • Proficient in JTAG/ETM debugging tools.
  • Post Graduate (MSc or equivalent) applicable STEM subject.


Remuneration:


  • £30,000 - £37,500
  • Pension
  • Flexible working hours.
  • A comprehensive relocation package is available


Location: Derby, East Midlands


If you think you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Software Engineer
description:
This is an exciting opportunity to join an award winning, well-established and growing software company, based in Nottingham City Centre. Providing pioneering technology, you’ll contribute to a range of innovative and high-profile projects. The role covers all aspects of software production, but the focus is on the development of web applications.


Technologies used include:


  • ASP.NET MVC with C# 6 & 7 (Web API, RESTful)
  • SQL Server 2016 (complex data transformations, high performance querying)
  • Reactive, modern designs (Bootstrap, SVG, Highcharts, D3.js)
  • Extensive JavaScript use (MVVM via Knockout.js, SPA via Durandal)
  • Distributed architecture (MassTransit, RabbitMQ)
  • .NET Core with Identity Server

Requirements:


We’re looking for capable, highly literate and personable people with web application development experience with the Microsoft development stack, particularly C#, although other relevant skills and experience will be considered.


Just as importantly, we need you to be able to analyse problems, produce effective documentation and see projects through to fruition. We want you to use your skills and experience to help shape the direction of products you are working on.


In particular, the experience we’re looking for is in:


  • Implementing web applications using MVC/MVVM patterns
  • MS SQL Server, including optimised stored procedures, performance analysis, optimisation and tuning
  • JavaScript frameworks, particularly Knockout.js
  • Rich Single Page Application-style user interfaces


Any of the following experience would be beneficial:


  • High Availability (HA) & Disaster Recovery (DR)
  • Statistical calculations and modelling
  • Developing software for healthcare


Remuneration and Benefits:


  • £35,000 - £45,000 + Benefits
  • Friendly, relaxed environment
  • Flexible working conditions
  • Ongoing professional development and training tailored to you


Location:


Nottingham City Centre


If you think you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to hear from you!

title: PHP Developer
description:

You will not be afraid to adopt best practice; the current software stack already utilizes automated unit testing, continuous integration, git and a flexible approach to continuous deployment. However, support and modification of existing legacy projects is a key component of the role.

title: Front End Developer
description:
The role will traverse the entire software delivery lifecycle. We are looking for candidates with not only great technical abilities, but commercial awareness and communication skills as there will be significant exposure to internal business teams and product owners.

The ideal candidate will be an exceptionally talented Front-end/Javascript Developer who is passionate about producing solutions of the highest possible standard and working on bleeding edge products with a team of like-minded peers.

title: C++ Developer
description:

The role will have active daily involvement in writing code and working alongside the team to prioritise tasks and deliver projects. As a Senior member of the team, the role also plays a very active part in training and mentoring more junior members of the team.

  • Strong mathematical and probability skills

title: Software Engineer
description:
Expanding Software House is looking to grow its development team to accelerate the delivery of software to customers and is looking for a number of experienced Software Engineers to join the team.


These opportunities are exclusive to Cordius and fully remote working is available!


We are looking for capable, highly literate and personable people with application development experience with the Microsoft development stack. Working on a very user-friendly, browser-based application, we require experience in C#, JavaScript skills and an understanding of MVVM design patterns for the role. The project is code-first, so SQL skills are less important. Offering mobile applications, there is the possibility of working on these too.


Just as importantly, you will need to be able to analyse problems, produce effective documentation and see projects through to fruition. They will want you to use your skills and experience to help shape the direction of products you are working on.


These are the technologies the team uses …

  • Front-End frameworks, including Bootstrap & LESS, and package management tools like gulp & bower
  • JavaScript frameworks/libraries such as jQuery, Knockout.js, Durandal, Require.js


You will be organised, highly literate and able to integrate quickly into the existing team. You will be confident enough to talk about new ideas you have and explain clearly how they work and how they can improve what you are working on.


Salary: £35,000 - £45,000 + Benefits

Location: Nottingham City Centre and/or Remote Working

title: .NET Developer
description:

title: Senior Developer
description:
I am working with a fast-moving software and services company based in Derby. They’ve been growing over the last 5 years, and plan to continue this. They work with some of the biggest brands in the world and their software is used in more than 80 countries worldwide. It is web delivered, using cutting edge technologies, and is under constant development.

My client is passionate about what they do and are looking to attract team members who have that same passion about technology, are sociable and positive and who aspire to create a high standard of maintainable software to its end users.

title: Software Engineer C#
description:
Expanding Software House is looking to grow its development team to accelerate the delivery of software to customers and is looking for a number of experienced Software Engineers to join the team.


These opportunities are exclusive to Cordius and fully remote working is available!


We are looking for capable, highly literate and personable people with application development experience with the Microsoft development stack. There will be a lot of SQL work in the product, so that needs to be an area of experience/interest. This role is purely a development position (so no expectations of team leadership etc. in the short-medium term). You will need to understand data, and the challenges of managing it, ideally on a large scale.


Just as importantly, you will need to be able to analyse problems, produce effective documentation and see projects through to fruition. They will want you to use your skills and experience to help shape the direction of products you are working on.


These are the technologies the team uses …


  • ASP.NET MVC with C# 6 & 7 (Web API, Entity Framework, RESTful)
  • SQL Server (via EF with LINQ and stored procedures)
  • SSIS
  • Front-End frameworks, including Bootstrap & LESS, and package management tools like gulp & bower

  • NUnit for unit and integration tests
  • Agile process (Scrum, CI using Octopus, Kanban, automated testing)


You will be organised, highly literate and able to integrate quickly into the existing team. You will be confident enough to talk about new ideas you have and explain clearly how they work and how they can improve what you are working on.


Salary: £35,000 - £45,000 + Benefits

Location: Nottingham City Centre and/or Remote Working


Would you like to know more? ... Contact the Cordius team today for a confidential, no-obligation chat.
